mso-highlight: yellow;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"background: yellow; mso-highlight: yellow;\">The\nLand of Punt is described in ancient Egyptian texts as \"the land of the\ngods\" is the state of Kerala on the SW coast of India\u2014my state<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"background: yellow; mso-highlight: yellow;\">The\nland of Punt ( Kerala/ India ) produced the first and only FEMALE Pharoah\ncalled Queen Hatshepsut. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"background: yellow; mso-highlight: yellow;\">It is\nrecorded that Imhotep was from the land of Punt. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"background: yellow; mso-highlight: yellow;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/08/imhotep-patron-saint-of-freemasons-capt.html</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"background: yellow; mso-highlight: yellow;\">Queen\nHatshepsut got Aloe Vera from Punt from which she made incense and Cinnamon\nwhich was used for embalming mummies.. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"background: yellow; mso-highlight: yellow;\">She was\nthe chief wife of Thutmose II-- Officially, she ruled jointly with Thutmose\nIII, ( her husband\u2019s son by a harem whore ) who had ascended to the throne the\nprevious year as a child of about two years old<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"background: yellow; mso-highlight: yellow;\">Hatshepsut\nruled as a Pharoah for 20 years.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"background: yellow; mso-highlight: yellow;\">After\nQueen Hatshesput died\u2014she was deleted from Egyptian history. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"background: yellow; mso-highlight: yellow;\">Hatshepsut's\nnumerous statues were torn down and in many cases, smashed or disfigured before\nbeing buried in a pit.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"background: yellow; mso-highlight: yellow;\">Much\nlater Apollonius of Tyna would be deleted the same way.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"background: yellow; mso-highlight: yellow;\">A mural\nfrom Queen Hatshepsut's Temple at Dier el-Bahri on the Nile River includes a\nmaize cob ( Indian corn ) and a pineapple\u2014both from Kerala.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"background: yellow; mso-highlight: yellow;\"><span style=\"color: red;\">https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_P_t_gDT5i0</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"background: yellow; mso-highlight: yellow;\">Hatshepsut`s\nreign was marked by the building of numerous monuments. In the evening at the\ngreat temple of Karnak in Luxor, we see the towering obelisk erected by\nHatshepsut to worship the god Amun. Pharaohs claimed to be descended from\nAmun-Ra, the sun god\u2026<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"background: yellow; mso-highlight: yellow;\">Hatshepsut\nclaimed descent from the gods\u2026 The Mortuary Temple of Hatshepsut is one of the\nmost beautiful of all of the temples of Ancient Egypt. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"background: yellow; mso-highlight: yellow;\">This\ntemple had top soil lifted from Kerala with many Ayurvedic herbs. Ramesses II\nand Merneptah both made additions to her temple. , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">Gen 9:24 And Noah awoke\nfrom his wine, and knew what his younger son had done unto him.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">Gen 9:25 And he said,\nCursed be Canaan; a servant of servants shall he be unto his brethren.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\">WHAT IS \u201c NAKEDNESS OF\nHIS FATHER&nbsp; \u201c<o:p></o:p></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\">IT JUST MEANS HE\nSCREWED HIS OWN MOTHER\u2014INCEST<o:p></o:p></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; , serif; line-height: 150%;\">New International\nVersion</span> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: white; font-size: large;\">Genesis\n5:32:-&nbsp; After Noah was 500 years old, he\nbecame the father of Shem, Ham and Japheth.</span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Leviticus 20:11 (\nEnglish standard version ) And the man that lieth with his father's wife hath\nuncovered his father's nakedness: both of them shall surely be put to death;\ntheir blood shall be upon them.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">New American Standard\nBible Leviticus 18:7:- 'You shall not uncover the nakedness of your father,\nthat is, the nakedness of your mother. She is your mother; you are not to\nuncover her nakedness.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">American Standard\nVersion Leviticus 20:11:-And the man that lieth with his father's wife hath\nuncovered his father's nakedness: both of them shall surely be put to death;\ntheir blood shall be upon them.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">English Standard\nVersion Leviticus 20:11:-If a man lies with his father\u2019s wife, he has uncovered\nhis father\u2019s nakedness; both of them shall surely be put to death; their blood\nis upon them.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Deuteronomy 27:20:-'Cursed\nis he who lies with his father's wife, because he has uncovered his father's\nskirt.' And all the people shall say, 'Amen.'<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Deuteronomy 20:27:-\nCursed be he that lieth with his father's wife; because he uncovereth his\nfather's skirt. And all the people shall say, Amen.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">New International\nVersion<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">If anyone is worried\nthat he might not be acting honorably toward the virgin he is engaged to, and\nif his passions are too strong and he feels he ought to marry, he should do as\nhe wants. He is not sinning. They should get married.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">New Living Translation<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">But if a man thinks\nthat he's treating his fiancee improperly and will inevitably give in to his\npassion, let him marry her as he wishes. It is not a sin.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">If anyone thinks that\nhe is not behaving properly toward his betrothed, if his passions are strong,\nand it has to be, let him do as he wishes: let them marry\u2014it is no sin.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">But if any man thinks\nthat he is acting unbecomingly toward his virgin daughter, if she is past her\nyouth, and if it must be so, let him do what he wishes, he does not sin; let\nher marry.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; He is not sinning; they can get\nmarried.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">International Standard\nVersion<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">If a man thinks he is\nnot behaving properly toward his virgin, and if his passion is so strong that\nhe feels he ought to marry her, let him do what he wants; he isn't sinning. Let\nthem get married.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">NET Bible<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">If anyone thinks he is acting\ninappropriately toward his virgin, if she is past the bloom of youth and it\nseems necessary, he should do what he wishes; he does not sin. Let them marry.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">Aramaic Bible in Plain\nEnglish<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">But if a man thinks he\nis disgraced by his virgin who is past her time and he has not given her to a\nman, and it is fitting to give her as he chooses to do, he does not sin; she\nmay be married.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">GOD'S WORD\u00ae Translation<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">No father would want to\ndo the wrong thing when his virgin daughter is old enough to get married. If\nshe wants to get married, he isn't sinning by letting her get married.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">But if any man think\nthat he behaves himself improperly toward his virgin, if she pass the prime of\nher age, and need so require, let him do what he desires, he sins not: let them\nmarry.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">But if any man thinketh\nthat he behaveth himself unseemly toward his virgin daughter , if she be past\nthe flower of her age, and if need so requireth, let him do what he will; he\nsinneth not; let them marry.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; he sinneth not, if she\nmarry.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; he\nsinneth not; let them marry.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">But if any man thinketh\nthat he behaveth himself uncomely towards his virgin, if she hath passed the\nflower of her age, and need so requireth, let him do what he will, he sinneth\nnot: let them marry.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">Weymouth New Testament<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">If, however, a father\nthinks he is acting unbecomingly towards his still unmarried daughter if she be\npast the bloom of her youth, and so the matter is urgent, let him do what she\ndesires; he commits no sin; she and her suitor should be allowed to marry.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">World English Bible<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">But if any man thinks\nthat he is behaving inappropriately toward his virgin, if she is past the\nflower of her age, and if need so requires, let him do what he desires. He\ndoesn't sin. Let them marry.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">Young's Literal\nTranslation<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">and if any one doth\nthink it to be unseemly to his virgin, if she may be beyond the bloom of age,\nand it ought so to be, what he willeth let him do; he doth not sin -- let him\nmarry.</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">And Lot went up out of\nZoar, and dwelt in the mountain, and his two daughters with him; for he feared\nto dwell in Zoar: and he dwelt in a cave, he and his two daughters.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">31 And the firstborn\nsaid unto the younger, Our father is old, and there is not a man in the earth\nto come in unto us after the manner of all the earth:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">34 And it came to pass\non the morrow, that the firstborn said unto the younger, Behold, I lay\nyesternight with my father: let us make him drink wine this night also; and go\nthou in, and lie with him, that we may preserve seed of our father.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; so when he went in to his\nbrother's wife, he wasted his seed on the ground in order not to give offspring\nto his brother.\u2026<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">NOT ANY MORE !<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">From the Early Middle\nAges (c. 500 AD) all the way up to the early 19th century the most dominant\nview was that the ancient Egyptians were the lineal descendants of Ham, through\nhis son Mizraim <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Asiatic Race Theory\nholds that the ancient Egyptians were the lineal descendants of the biblical\nHam, through his son Mizraim. <o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Bible refers to\nEgypt as \"the land of Ham\" in Psalms.78:51; 105:23,27; 106:22; 1\nChronicles 4:40. <o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The name Ham to a\nHebrew word for \"burnt\"\u2026&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ham is the ancient\nEgyptian word for Africans.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In 18th- and\n19th-century Euro-America, Genesis 9:18-27 became the curse of Ham, a\nfoundation myth for collective degradation, conventionally trotted out as God's\nreason for condemning generations of dark-skinned peoples from Africa to\nslavery.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In prior centuries,\nJews, Christians and Muslims had exploited this story for other purposes, often\ntangential to the later peculiar preoccupation.'<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ham was the forefather\nof those who made up great cities and empires, including Babylon, Assyria,\nNinevah, and Egypt.. From Canaan come those nations which made up those known\ngenerally as the Canaanites<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In Genesis 9, we note\nthe curse which Noah pronounced on his grandson for Ham's apparent act of\nincest; Canaan's descendants would now have to serve Shem's descendants which\nis what happened when the Jews, descended from Shem, inherited the Promised\nLand! <o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the bible the blacks\nare referred to as the children/people of Ham (or as Hamites). Africa is the\n'Land of Ham '. <o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">During the Middle Ages,\nbelieving Jews, Christians, and Muslims incorrectly considered Ham to be the\nancestor of all Africans.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Some Arab slave traders\nused the account of Noah and Ham in the Bible to justify Negro (Zanj) slavery,\nand later European and American Christian traders and slave owners adopted a\nsimilar argument.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">To justify the\nenslavement of the Canaanites and the seizing of their lands by the Jews it was\ninjected into the Hebrew story that the children of Ham were cursed with\nslavery and were forever destined to serve their brothers, Shem and Japheth.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">THESE ARE THE CUNTS WHO\nACCUSE HINDUS OF ILLTREATING DALITS<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 150%;\">The children of Shem\nwere Elam, Asshur, Arphaxad, Lud and Aram, in addition to daughters. Abraham,\nthe patriarch of the Hebrews and Arabs, was one of the descendants of Arphaxad.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The name Semite comes\nfrom Shem, the eldest of the three sons of Noah. In the Greek and Latin\nversions of the Bible, Shem becomes Sem, since neither Greek nor Latin has any\nway of representing the initial sound of the Hebrew name.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Bible tells us that\neveryone on earth was drowned except for Noah and his family and that all\nmankind are descended from his three sons, Shem, Ham, and Japheth. The lines of\ndescent from the three of them, described in the tenth chapter of Genesis,<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; ancestor of the dark</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;ms mincho&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2011</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">skinned peoples of Africa, Shem of the Hebrews and\ntheir various cognates, and Japheth the ancestor of the Medes, Persians,\nGreeks, and other peoples who, many centuries later, came to be known as\nAryans.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">While Shem and his sons\nare of biblical antiquity, the Semite is of much more recent origin, The terms\n\"anti-Semite\" or \"antisemitism\" came by a circuitous route\nto refer more narrowly to anyone who was hostile or discriminatory towards Jews\nin particular<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;The Curse of Ham described in Judaism's religious\ntexts was a justification for slavery - citing the Tanakh (Jewish Bible) verses\nGenesis 9:20-27 and the Talmud.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Slavery is the response\nto Ham's rebellious behavior, you see<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; After founder\nJoseph Smith's death, leaders of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day\nSaints (LDS Church) continued to teach that black Africans were under the curse\nof Ham and that those who tried to abolish slavery were going against the\ndecrees of God<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; line-height: 150%;\">At some point after the\nslave trade in the United States began, many Protestant denominations created\nby JEWS&nbsp; began teaching that the mark of\nCain was a dark skin tone, a The Curse of Cain was often conflated with the\nCurse of Ham.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Cain and Abel&nbsp; were sons of Adam and Eve.&nbsp; Cain, the firstborn, tilled the soil, and his\nbrother Abel was a shepherd. The brothers made sacrifices to God, each of his\nown produce, but God favored Abel's sacrifice instead of that of Cain. Cain\nmurdered Abel. God punished Cain to a life of wandering, but set a mark on him\nso that no man would kill him.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">THESE ARE THE CUNTS WHO\nACCUSE HINDUS OF ILLTREATING DALITS<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">One interpretation\nstates that Ham married a descendant of Cain, who was black, so that the\ndescendants of Canaan were both marked with black skin and cursed to be\nservants of servants.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">While there is no indication in the Bible of Ham's wife\ndescending from Cain, this interpretation was used to justify slavery and was\nparticularly popular in America during the Atlantic slave trade.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mormonism\nbegan during the height of white Protestant acceptance of the curse of Cain\ndoctrine in America, as well as the even more popular curse of Ham doctrine.\nMormons of the 19th century commonly assumed that black Africans had Cain's \"mark\"\nof black skin, and Ham's curse to be servants of servants&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">After the death of\nJoseph Smith, The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints (LDS Church) was\nthe largest of several organizations claiming succession from Smith's church. <o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">THESE ARE THE CUNTS WHO\nACCUSE HINDUS OF ILLTREATING DALITS<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Brigham Young (the\nsecond President of the Church) accepted the idea that people of African\nancestry were generally under the curse of Cain, and in 1852 he made a\nstatement that people of black African descent were not eligible to hold the\nchurch's priesthood.&nbsp; &nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In 18th and 19th century America, prior to the\nCivil War, the Cain and Ham curses were interpreted by many Christians as\nexplaining the skin color of black Africans and as justifying the practice of\nAfrican slavery. After slavery ended, and as late as the 1960s, the curse on\nHam continued to be put to work by some Christians to justify ethnic\nsegregation. <o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">THESE ARE THE CUNTS WHO\nACCUSE HINDUS OF ILLTREATING DALITS<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In Genesis-- Ham\nobserves a drunk and unclothed Noah. Noah responds by enigmatically \u201ccursing\u201d\nHam\u2019s son Canaan: \u201cCursed be Canaan; a servant of servants shall he be unto his\nbrethren.\u201d The text itself contains no reference to skin color and Noah doesn\u2019t\nsuggest the curse applies to Canaan\u2019s descendants.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Yet thousands of years later\nthis curse was redirected to Ham and became a keystone in how European and\nAmerican Christians justified African slavery..&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the course of his long\nhistory Ham was Egyptian, heretic, sinner, sodomite, Jew, Muslim, Mongol,\nBlack, Asian, and African.\u201d or Priest, the claim that Ham had black skin relied\nprimarily on the argument that Ham\u2019s name meant \u201cblack\u201d (so he thought), so Ham\nmust have been black. <o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">THESE ARE THE CUNTS WHO\nACCUSE HINDUS OF ILLTREATING DALITS<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When Utah was\nconsidering slavery, Brigham Young told the Utah Territorial Legislature that\nthe curse of Cain required slavery. He argued that until all of the descendants\nof Abel had access to the priesthood, that the descendants of Cain should\nremain in servitude&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He argued that\nbecause they did not have the right to the govern in the affairs of the Church,\nbecause of the priesthood ban, that they shouldn't have the right to govern in\nthe affairs of the state, including voting.e warned that if they made the\nchildren of Cain equal to them, that they would be cursed. &nbsp;He also argued that if someone married a\ndescendant of Cain, that they would also have the same curse.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">According to the Hebrew\nBible, non-Hebrew slaves were drawn primarily from the neighboring Canaanite\nnations, and religious justification was provided for the enslavement of these\nneighbors: the rules governing Canaanites was based on a curse aimed at Canaan,\na son of Ham, but in later eras the Canaanite slavery laws were stretched to apply\nto all non-Hebrew slaves<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">THESE ARE THE CUNTS WHO\nACCUSE HINDUS OF ILLTREATING DALITS</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Canaan was the ancestor\nof the tribes who originally occupied the ancient Land of Canaan: Canaan's\nfirstborn son was Sidon, who shares his name with the Phoenician city of Sidon\nin present-day Lebanon. His second son was Heth. w the curse of Canaan in\nGenesis 9:20-27 as an early Hebrew rationalization for Israel's conquest of\nCanaan.</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When Noah cursed Canaan in Genesis 9:25, he used the expression \"Cursed\nbe Canaan; A servant of servants He shall be to his brethren.\"NKJV The\nexpression \"servant of servants\", otherwise translated \"slave of\nslaves\",NIV emphasizes the extreme degree of servitude that Canaan will\nexperience in relation to his \"brothers\".-- his narrative used Noah\nto curse Canaan, in order to provide justification for the later Israelites\ndriving out and enslaving the Canaanites.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hebrew myths of the\nGenesis claim that these&nbsp; oral traditions\ngrew out of a need of the Israelites to rationalize their subjugation of\nCanaan,&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">THESE ARE THE CUNTS WHO\nACCUSE HINDUS OF ILLTREATING DALITS<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Leo Africanus,the great Arab traveller and\none-time protege of Pope Leo X, wrote about Negro Africans as being descended\nfrom Ham<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">By and large, however,\nthe Negro was seen as a descendant of Ham, bearing the stigma of Noah's curse.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;On the one hand, it allowed exploitation of\nthe Negro for economic gain to remain undisturbed by any Christian doubts as to\nthe moral issues involved. 'A servant of servants shall he be' clearly meant\nthat the Negro was preordained for slavery. Neither individual nor collective\nguilt was to be borne for a state of the world created by the Almighty. <o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Western world,\nwhich was growing increasingly rich on the institution of slavery, grew\nincreasingly reluctant to look at the Negro slave and see him as a brother\nunder the skin.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">THESE ARE THE CUNTS WHO\nACCUSE HINDUS OF ILLTREATING DALITS<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">At the height of their\npower during this time, the Israelites made the Canaanites slaves rather than\nwiping them out. Perhaps the Israelites believed putting these people into\nforced labor was more beneficial than destroying them<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Moses warned the\nIsraelites not to adopt the sexual behaviour and practises of the Canaanites\nand other tribes within the Promised Land in Leviticus 18:6-18 and Exodus\n23:23-24.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Historically&nbsp; Jewish people owned and traded slaves.\nAncient Israelite society allowed slavery Slaves were seen as an essential part\nof a Hebrew household. The Hebrew Bible contains two sets of rules governing\nslaves: one set for Hebrew slaves (Lev 25:39-43) and a second set for Canaanite\nslaves (Lev 25:45-46)<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">THESE ARE THE CUNTS WHO\nACCUSE HINDUS OF ILLTREATING DALITS<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The laws governing\nnon-Hebrew slaves were more harsh than those governing Hebrew slaves:\nnon-Hebrew slaves could be owned permanently, and bequeathed to the owner's\nchildren, whereas Hebrew slaves were treated as servants, and were released\nafter six years of service or the occurrence of a jubilee year.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">That the distinction was due to the fact that\nnon-Hebrew slaves were subject to the curse of Canaan, whereas God did not want\nJews to be SLAVES Most slaves owned by Israelites were non-Hebrew, Israelites\ncontinued to own Hebrew slaves through the Middle Ages &nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Talmud (200\u2013500\nAD ) contains an extensive set of laws governing slavery, which is more\ndetailed, and different from the original laws found in the Jewish Bible. <o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">THESE ARE THE CUNTS WHO\nACCUSE HINDUS OF ILLTREATING DALITS<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">One of the few rules\nthat distinguished between Jewish and non-Jewish slaves regarded found\nproperty: items found by Jewish slaves were owned by the slave, but items found\nby a non-Jewish slave belonged to the slave owner.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Another change was that the\nTalmud explicitly prohibits the freeing of a non-Jewish slave, which was\nstricter that the biblical law&nbsp; which was\nsilent on the issue, and simply permitted slaves to be owned indefinitely.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">THESE ARE THE CUNTS WHO\nACCUSE HINDUS OF ILLTREATING DALITS<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Torah allows sex with\nnon-engaged slaves, by clarifying that if she is engaged when the master has\nsex with her, \"they are not to be put to death, since she was not\nfreed\" (which implies that a woman's slave status has direct bearing on\nwhether she can be used for sex). Biblical rules for treatment of Jewish slaves\nwere more lenient than for non-Jewish slaves&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Talmudic laws required Jewish\nslave owners to try to convert non-Jewish slaves to Judaism. Other laws\nrequired slaves, if not converted, to be circumcised and undergo ritual\nimmersion in a bath (mikveh).<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">THESE ARE THE CUNTS WHO\nACCUSE HINDUS OF ILLTREATING DALITS<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Jewish slave owners were not permitted to\ndrink wine that had been touched by an uncircumcised person so there was always\na practical need, in addition to the legal requirement, to circumcise slaves.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">During the Middle Ages, Jews acted as slave-traders in Slavonia North Africa,\nBaltic States, Central and Eastern Europe, Spain and Portugal, and Mallorca The\nmost significant Jewish involvement in the slave-trade was in Spain and\nPortugal during the 10th to 15th centuries.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">THESE ARE THE CUNTS WHO\nACCUSE HINDUS OF ILLTREATING DALITS<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; gratefully borrowed by Christians in the\nMiddle Ages<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; HE WANTED \"COOKED UP \" JESUS CHRIST TO BE EMBEDDED IN COSMIC ALLEGORIES<br />\n<br />\nI HAVE WRITTEN ALL THIS 6 YEARS AGO-- THIS IS ABOUT PRECESSION OF EARTH-- 25765 YEARS WHICH ONLY INDIAN SAGES KNEW .<br />\n<br />\nwhat is bull ( taurus ) , ram ( aries ), two fishes ( pisces ) , water carrier ( aquarius ) etc<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/11/vedic-cosmology-of-india-5000-bc-capt.html</span><br />\n<br />\nHOW DO I KNOW ALL THIS ?<br />\n<br />\nI AM A PROFESSIONAL MASTER MARINER .<br />\n<br />\nIN 1973 I TOLD MY NAVIGATION TEACHER ( A SHIP CAPTAIN ) THAT IT IS NOT GHA ARIES BUT GHA PISCES -- AND IT IS NOT POLARIS ( for pisces ) , BUT THUBAN ( for aries ) -- HE WAS UPSET<br />\n<br />\nNO TEACHER LIKES HIS STUDENT TO KNOW MORE<br />\n<br />\nSO THIS FELLOW ( NAME CAPT SK PURI ) FAILED ME TWICE-- ONCE FOR STAR RECOGNITION TICKET AND ONE FOR WHALER / CUTTER SAILING TICKET<br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n</li>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: purple;\">ONCE WHILE PASSING THOUGH\nA CANAL THE LOUD SPEAKER ON THE BRIDGE WING WAS INDISCERNIBLE &nbsp;DUE TO JARRING FALSE SOUND &nbsp;&nbsp;.&nbsp; &nbsp;I\nASKED FOR THE PILOT CHAIR TO BE BROUGHT OUT , STUCK THE CHEWING GUM FROM MY\nMOUTH ON THE CONE AND SOUND BECAME PERFECT . ALL WHO WATCHED THIS WAS MAHAAA\nIMPRESSED .<o:p></o:p></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">ANCIENT MAHARISHIS USED\nTHEIR OWN BODY DNA AS HELMHOLTZ COILS ..</span></b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/02/invisibility-capt-ajit-vadakayil.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/02/invisibility-capt-ajit-vadakayil.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The ENTIRE dynastic race\nof the Egyptian pharaohs came from the land of Punt.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When Queen Hatshepsut\nwent to the Land of Punt, the first thing she was asked by the King of Punt,\nwas why there is such a long interval since the last visit to Punt by a\nEgyptian Pharaoh.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hatshepsut\u2019s &nbsp;3,500-year-old temple at Deir el-Bahri near\nThebes contains a veritable book in stone describing Punt. &nbsp;She used the attar / oudh perfume oil ( sandalwood/\nJasmine ) &nbsp;from Punt.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Make a trip to\nCalicut and you will be amazed to see the number of shops selling Attar and\nOudh. Kerala middle east workers &nbsp;take these bottles\nto give as a present to the sheikh after vacation \u2014 and immediately the \"pleased like pudding \" &nbsp;sheikh\nwill give him a promotion and raise of wages\u2014it is assured.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hatshepsut and other\npharaohs sent huge expeditions to Punt\u2014flotillas of robust, seagoing ships with\nthousands of men. Hatshepsut and Sahure left behind maps which were destroyed\nby the white man. It showed one horned rhino which was found only in India.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">King Parehu, the only\nchief of Punt ever named in ancient records.. The consonant p in his name and\nthat of Punt itself also firmly excludes Arabia.&nbsp; Because Old South Arabian languages possess\nan F but no P. &nbsp;&nbsp;Arabia would have had a\nFarehu, chief of CUNT nay Funt!\" Egyptian has both consonants.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Like Persians had no S \u2013only\nH<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Asura was called Ahura\n. In Persia devas and asuras were reversed. Asuras were gods.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/06/shukracharya-is-ahura-mazda-god-of.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/06/shukracharya-is-ahura-mazda-god-of.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shukracharya was Guru\nof Danavas .&nbsp;&nbsp; I am a Danava. &nbsp;Shukracharya was advisor to King Mahabali of\nKerala.. Shukracharya was famous for his ability to resurrect dead people by\ncoaxing the departed soul back into the cadaver.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sir Ernest Alfred\nThompson Wallis Budge ( 1857 \u2013 1934) was an English Egyptologist, Orientalist,\nand philologist who worked for the British Museum and published numerous works\non the ancient Near East.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">E. A. Wallis Budge\nwrote \u201c Egyptian tradition of the Dynastic Period held that the aboriginal home\nof the Egyptians was Punt\u2026\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He made numerous trips\nto Egypt on behalf of the British Museum to buy antiquities<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pharaoh Sahure, the second\nruler of the Fifth Dynasty, who reigned for about 12 years in the early 25th\ncentury BC. had written about his expeditiont to Punt.. He was son of Neferhetepes\nand Userkaf<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In his rule Sahure ordered\na sea voyage too the land of Punt, which brought back large quantities of rosewood\n, and iridium infused electrum ( used in Kerala temple spires ) for use on the\napex of the &nbsp;pyramid built for himself in\nAbusir, &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sahure;s rule is recorded in the\nPalermo stone. Sahure stocked large quantities of myrrh\u2014these trees grow wild\nin Punt ( Kerala ) &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sahure\u2019s expedition to\nPunt returned with 80,000 measures of 'ntyw, ( myrrh )</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">An expedition to Punt\nwas ordered by Rameses III, in the 12th century B.C. An ancient papyrus records\nthat Rameses III \"constructed great transport vessels ... loaded with\nlimitless goods from Egypt. ... They reached the land of Punt, unaffected by\n(any) misfortune, safe and respected.\" And they returned safe and respected.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">THIS IS FOR THE STUPID\nKNANAYA CHRISTIANS OF KERALA WHO HAVE A SOFT SPORT FOR ISRAEL\u2014SOME OF THE ARE\nSLAVES OF WHITE JEWS <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The term Knanaya\nderives from the name of Thomas of Cana ( Knai Thoma). He was NOT a Christian\nbishop nor was he a Jew . <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">NOW KNANAYA KERALA\nCHRISTIANS LISTEN UP\u2014AND LISTEN GOOD.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">YOU HAVE BEEN MISLED BY\nWIKIPEDIA AND JEW ROTHSCHILD TO THINK THAT YOU ARE CHRISTIANS / JEWS.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">JUST LIKE THE NASRANIS\nYOU TOO CAME RUNNING TO KERALA BECAUSE YOUR ANCESTORS WERE BEING BURNT ALIVE (\nAFTER CHRISTIANITY RELIGION WAS BORN IN 325 AD ).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">YOUR ANCESTORS CAME\nRUNNING TO MUZIRIS BY SHIP , ALONG WITH THOMAS OF CANA IN 345 AD<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">THOSE DAYS ESSENES OF\nCANAAN WERE BEING BURNT ALIVE FOR WORSHIPING KALI ( ASHERAH/ ASHTORETH /\nASTHARTE )-&nbsp; ASHTA MEANS EIGHT ARMED KALI\n, THE GODDESS OF WAR.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">AZTECS OF MEXICO\nWORSHIPED THE SAME GODDESS.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; IN KERALA\nSHE IS KNOWS AS BHAGAWATI \u2013OF THE KODUNGALLUR TEMPLE.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">CHRISTINITY CAME TO\nCANAAN AREA IN PALESTINE VERY LATE.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">You shall tear down\ntheir altars and smash their sacred pillars and burn their Ashterim with fire,\nand you shall cut down the engraved images of their gods and obliterate their\nname from that place. (Deuteronomy 12:3)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Israelites also\nworshiped Asherah from as early as the time immediately following the death of\nJoshua (Judges 2:13).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Like how they got rid\nof Apollonius, the Christians and the Jews combined forces ( later joined by\nMuslims ) and destroyed every MULTI ARMED GOD IDOL in that entire area.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/09/lost-civilization-of-petra-capt-ajit.html\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/09/lost-civilization-of-petra-capt-ajit.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Let me quote Wikipedia\n\u2013<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">QUOTE :&nbsp; Herodotus wrote that the religious community\nof Aphrodite originated in Phoenicia and came to Greeks from there. He also\nwrote about the world's largest temple of Aphrodite, in one of the Phoenician\ncities. Her name is the second name in an energy chant sometimes used in Wicca:\n\"Isis, Astarte, Diana, Hecate, Demeter, Kali, Inanna.\"[14]&nbsp;&nbsp; UNQUOTE<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The term Knanaya\nderives from the name of Thomas of Cana ( Knai Thoma). He was NOT a Christian\nbishop nor was he a Jew . He was a merchant. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The story that there\nwas a Christian by name Uraha Mar Yousef ( Mor Joseph of Urfa)&nbsp; on the ship is BULL.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; These people were running away from\nChristians .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He lead a group of\nManichee ( Manichaens ) who were being burnt alive . <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Even today\n\"manichean\" is a derogatory term in Canaan&nbsp; like CHOOT or PRICK ( the Bible nowhere\nconnects the Kenites with Cain ).&nbsp; .&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In Kerala they are\ncalled ACHAYANS . <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Canaan was ruled by the\nEgyptian Pharoah.&nbsp; MOSES like Jesus is\nfake.&nbsp;&nbsp; It was Jethro who was Moses.\nJethro was a Kerala sage . <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Canaan Jethro, a priest\nin the land of Midian. The Bible and the Jews stole Pagan Jethro to be the\nfather in law of Moses.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Moses\u2019 father-in-law,\nJethro, was a Kenite (Judges 1:16)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Rechabites were same as\nNazirites, following the same rules of being vegan, non \u2013violent and\nteetotalers.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Jesus Christ and his 12\ndisciples of which Thomas was one, never existed <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">On December 21, 1923\nthe Vicariate Apostolic of Kottayam was raised to an Eparchy by Pope Pius XI.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;
