, &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">CHECK OUT THE BULL\nBELOW.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://www.stthomasknanayachurch.org/knanayahist.aspx\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://www.stthomasknanayachurch.org/knanayahist.aspx</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sir William Matthew\nFlinders Petrie, wrote that the dynastic race of Egyptian Pharaoh\u2019s was NOT\nfrom Egypt but from an alien land across the seas known as Punt. Petrie wrote\nthat the culture of Ancient Egypt was derived from an invading \"Dynastic\nRace\" which had conquered Egypt in late prehistory and introduced the\nPharaonic culture.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">William Matthew\nFlinders Petrie held the first chair of Egyptology in the United Kingdom, and\nexcavated many of the most important archaeological sites in Egypt in conjunction\nwith his wife.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In 1892 Petrie was\nEdwards professor of Egyptology at University College London<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>\"The origins of\npharaonic civilisation have always been shrouded in mystery. What caused\ndynastic culture to burst forth in the Nile valley within such a relatively\nshort period of time? ... There is little evidence of kingship and its rituals\nvery much before the beginning of the 1st Dynasty; no signs of the gradual\ndevelopment of metal working, art, monumental architecture and writing \u2013 the\ndefining criteria of early civilisation. Much of what we know about the\npharaohs and their complex culture seems to come into existence in a flash of\ninspiration.\" </i>--&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; David Rohl,\nLegend \u2013 the Genesis of Civilisation, 1998, p.265<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; color: blue; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><b>ABOVE IS LIKE SAYING ANCIENT\nGREEKS SUDDENLY BECAME GENIUSES FOR A COUPLE OF CENTURIES AND THEN SUDDENLY\nTHEY BECAME DUFFERS, FIT FOR NOTHING . &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</b></span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: white; color: red; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><b>LIGHT SWITCH ON -- AND THEN SUDDENLY OFF ?</b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b>EVERY VESTIGE OF ANCIENT GREEK KNOWLEDGE (\nPYTHAGORAS / PLATO / PTOLEMY TYPES ) &nbsp;IS\nSTOLEN AND PATENTED FROM KODUNGALLUR UNIVERSITY OF THE CALICUT KING ( MY\nHOMETOWN ). &nbsp;&nbsp;</b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: white;\">GREEKS WERE BLACKBALLED FOR\nPATENTING THINGS WHICH THEY LEARNT IN KERALA ( PUNT ) IN THEIR OWN NAMES</b><o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; This is the reason for HOLI festival which we in Kerala do NOT celebrate.</span><br />\n<span style=\"color: red;\"><br />https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1kyMhU5HEyA<br /><br />http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2017/03/holi-2017-capt-ajit-vadakayil.html</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-size: large;\">vishnu's vamana avatar banished kerala king mahabali to patala --far end of the world ( peru )<br /><br />vishnu's vamana avatar ( inca/ maya / aztec ) and ayyappa avatar ( egypt / cambodia ) worked outside india<br /><br />ayyappa superimposed orion at giza pyramids and draco ( sisumara ) with thuban at angkor wat in cambodia.</span><br />\n<br />\nthose days in 3900 BC nobody but indians knew anything about astronomy.<br />\n<span style=\"color: red;\"><b><br />WHAT IS SHOCKING IS THAT BY THIS WE SEE THAT THE NORTH POLE WAS AT THE ALASKA STONEHENGE AND THE EQUATOR RUNNING THROUGH GIZA- MOHENJODARO- ANGKOR WAT- EASTER ISLAND- NAZCA .</b></span><br />\n<br />\nTHIS ANCIENT EQUATOR EVEN RAN THROUGH PETRA WHICH WAS A HINDU CIVILIZATION<br />\n<br />\nhttp://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/09/lost-civilization-of-petra-capt-ajit.html<br />\n<br />\nWHEN I WROTE THE POST ABOVE ALL RIDICULED.<br />\n<br />\nTHESE SPOTS WERE CHOSEN AS EARLY AS 10,300 BC AS PER HINDU ASTRONOMY<br />\n<br />\nBIBLE WAS WRITTEN BY HINDU SAGES -- ROMAN EMPEROR TOOK THE HELP OF KERALA ASTRONOMERS IN 325 AD AT THE FIRST COUNCIL OF NICEA. HE WANTED \"COOKED UP \" JESUS CHRIST TO BE EMBEDDED IN COSMIC ALLEGORIES<br />\n<br />\nI HAVE WRITTEN ALL THIS 6 YEARS AGO-- THIS IS ABOUT PRECESSION OF EARTH-- 25765 YEARS WHICH ONLY INDIAN SAGES KNEW .<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\">what is bull ( taurus ) , ram ( aries ), two fishes ( pisces ) , water carrier ( aquarius ) etc&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"color: blue;\"><br />http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/11/vedic-cosmology-of-india-5000-bc-capt.html</span><br />\n<br />\nHOW DO I KNOW ALL THIS ?<br />\n<br />\nI AM A PROFESSIONAL MASTER MARINER .<br />\n<br />\nIN 1973 I TOLD MY NAVIGATION TEACHER ( A SHIP CAPTAIN ) THAT IT IS NOT GHA ARIES BUT GHA PISCES -- AND IT IS NOT POLARIS ( for pisces ) &nbsp;, BUT THUBAN ( for aries ) -- HE WAS UPSET<br />\n<br />\nNO TEACHER LIKES HIS STUDENT TO KNOW MORE<br />\n<br />\nSO THIS FELLOW ( NAME CAPT SK PURI ) <b style=\"font-size: 16px;\"><span style=\"color: red;\">FAILED ME TWICE</span></b>-- ONCE FOR STAR RECOGNITION TICKET AND ONE FOR WHALER / CUTTER SAILING TICKET<br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; float: left; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-57G2xiZ-5tM/WJwrrVpmOmI/AAAAAAABQqo/-9wsspdm4RAiWSVRYXpBpkgoVBQdEyLRQCK4B/s35/*\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c9204541069247952020\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_127M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2017/05/land-of-punt-ophir-and-sheba-is-north.html?showComment=1495978128106#c9204541069247952020\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">May 28, 2017 at 6:58 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_127MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nREGARDING FAILING IN MY WHALER/ CUTTER SAILING TICKET \u2013 SOMEONE WANTED TO KNOW MORE.<br />\n<br />\nI WAS PART OF THE CHAMPION SAILING TEAM IN BOTH MY YEARS AS A JUNIOR AND SENIOR OF MY STARBOARD FORE TOP<br />\n<br />\nIN JUNIORS FORM YOU CAN BE PART OF THE SAILING TEAM\u2014 BUT AS A JUNIOR I FOUND A PLACE IN THE SENIORS TEAM ( IN SOCCER TOO ) .<br />\n<br />\nTHEY USUALLY TAKE ONE JUNIOR CADET TO BAIL OUT WATER FROM THE BILGES .<br />\n<br />\nIN MY CASE I DID NOT DO THAT\u2014SOME SENIOR DID THIS\u2014WHILE I ENDED THE BOW SAIL AS AN EXPERT WHO KNEW HOW TO SAIL INTO THE WIND<br />\n<br />\nTHE JUNIOR WHO HAS THE PRIVILEGE OF BALING OUT SALT WATER FROM THE BILGES WILL BE GIVEN A \u201cSAILING TICK\u201d- DRINKING SEA WATER FROM THE BILGES FROM A SENIORS STINKING CANVAS SHOE. I DID IT ONLY ONCE<br />\n<br />\nWHEN YOU SAIL AGAINST THE WIND THE PERSON WHO TENDS THE BOW SAIL WINS THE RACE<br />\n<br />\nSailing into the wind is a sailing expression that refers to a sail boat's ability to move forward despite being headed into (or very nearly into) the wind. A sailboat cannot make headway by sailing directly into the wind , so the point of sail into the wind is called \"close hauled\", and is 22\u00b0 to the apparent wind.<br />\n<br />\nThe cutter had a droppable steel keel \u2013which had to be tended<br />\n<br />\nThe heeling force of the sail is balanced by the force of the keel. This keeps the boat from moving in the direction of the sail force. Although total sail force is to the side when sailing into the wind, a proper angle of attack moves the boat forward.<br />\nTacking or coming about is a sailing maneuver by which a sailing vessel whose desired course is into the wind, not possible to do on a sailing vessel, turns its bow into the wind so that the direction from which the wind blows changes from one side to the other, allowing progress in the desired direction. The opposite maneuver to tacking is called jibing, that is, turning the stern through the wind.<br />\n<br />\nNo sailing vessel can move directly upwind, though that may be the desired direction, making this an essential maneuver of a sailing ship. A series of tacking moves, in a zig-zag fashion, is called beating, and allows sailing in the desired direction.<br />\n<br />\nCheck the video \u2013there are two sails\u2014the BOW sail and the MAIN sail.<br />\n<span style=\"color: red;\"><br />https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yqwb4HIrORM</span><br />\n<br />\nTODAY ALL THIS EXHILARATION OF TACKING AND GYBING IS A DISTANT MEMORY. &nbsp; &nbsp;ON SUNDAYS WE LEFT THE SHIP AFTER LUNCH AND CAME BACK AFTER SUNSET\u2014 GOING AS FAR AS THE KARANJIA AND ELEPHANTA ISLANDS<br />\n<br />\nWHEN I CAME BACK AFTER SAILING \u2014 SENIORS ON BOARD , WHO KNEW I WAS PRIVILEGED , WOULD ASK ME \u201d POP SHOT EH ? \u201c<br />\n<br />\nAND THEN THE WOULD MAKE ME SIT ON CASSOPEA CHAIR &nbsp;( INVISIBLE CHAIR ) \u2013 &nbsp;GREAT STRAIN ON ARMS , LEGS AND SPINE<br />\n<br />\nSTAND BY FOR A GYBE \u2014 AS A BOWMAN THE BACK OF MY PARALLEL BODY WOULD SKIM THE WATER SURFACE . I WAS GOOD AT IT.<br />\n<br />\nSTAND BY FOR A GYBE\u2014 TIME TO SWING LIKE TARZAN -- &nbsp;OH BOY , &nbsp;MY BODY HAIRS JUST STOOD UP !!<br />\n<br />\nCapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; Kerala is the most beautiful part of the planet<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Land of Punt\ndesignation as Ta Netjer by the Egyptian people which literally can be\ntranslated as the Land of the Gods, is the abode of the gods, and its location\nis toward the sunrise, where sun god Ra. The Land of Gods can be interpreted as\n\u201cthe land of the ancestors\u201d, which means that the ancient Egyptians viewed the\nLand of Punt as their ancestral land.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; line-height: 150%;\">-they would have had every large peak cap sizes&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-LdGZFCZ9jAE/WSra685WbII/AAAAAAABTzA/BFKbjI1NegwPDNpbYrVt60DeGlIlU1giACLcB/s1600/elongated44skullsegypt.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"222\" data-original-width=\"620\" height=\"228\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-LdGZFCZ9jAE/WSra685WbII/AAAAAAABTzA/BFKbjI1NegwPDNpbYrVt60DeGlIlU1giACLcB/s640/elongated44skullsegypt.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-ZgV2IB6moQI/WSrdgYShPEI/AAAAAAABTzM/q_kExWjOPY8B6qvBhsYrEb2927vvxpKVQCLcB/s1600/EGtkw050e44AkhenatenSkull.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"576\" data-original-width=\"720\" height=\"512\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-ZgV2IB6moQI/WSrdgYShPEI/AAAAAAABTzM/q_kExWjOPY8B6qvBhsYrEb2927vvxpKVQCLcB/s640/EGtkw050e44AkhenatenSkull.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/S-Jjb94G5ls/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/S-Jjb94G5ls?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/h-vN6Iqhl3Y/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/h-vN6Iqhl3Y?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Almost every ruling\ndynasty in ancient times has elongated skull as seen from their tombs. Hindus\ncremated, hence their skulls are missing. Skull had to POP during cremation for\nthe soul to get a solition wave ride to any of the 7 astral layers .&nbsp; Elongated skull have been recorded for\nroyalty in Maya, Inca, Aztec civilizations<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The inscription on the\ncolonnade of the Temple of Queen Hatshepsut at Deir el-Bahari describe that\nbalsam is the product of Punt.&nbsp;&nbsp; Camphor,\n( karpooram ) is one of the ingredients to concoct balsam.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Camphor trees\n(Dryobalanops sp), a tall timber tree grows wild in Kerala.&nbsp; In my puja room camphor is always there<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mersa/Wadi Gawasis was\nthe pharaonic port of Saww for seafaring expeditions to Punt. Bard and\nFattovich in 2001 revealed ceremonial structures, ship timbers, stone anchors,\nropes, and other artifacts dating to early and later Twelfth Dynasty. They also\nuncovered carbonized ebony woods, as well as blades of a steering oar. They\nfound cargo boxes bearing painted hieroglyphic text describing the contents as\nthe \u201cwonderful things of Punt\u201d.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-ZS14mvCF9v0/WSrj4D2w72I/AAAAAAABTzo/leoKb9JjW8UXfbJj_2om0BzPokq-VXs-gCLcB/s1600/the-foot-of-a-hinssdu-man-wearing-a-brass-object-on-his-foot-in-trichur-c6nty1.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"447\" data-original-width=\"640\" height=\"446\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-ZS14mvCF9v0/WSrj4D2w72I/AAAAAAABTzo/leoKb9JjW8UXfbJj_2om0BzPokq-VXs-gCLcB/s640/the-foot-of-a-hinssdu-man-wearing-a-brass-object-on-his-foot-in-trichur-c6nty1.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Someone asked me how\ncan you be so sure that the ruler of Punt is a Kerala man. The reason is the\nruler who met Queen Hatshesput wore a huge brass amulet on his left ankle . My\ngrandfather wore this.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nobody does this anymore in Kerala-- except the Theyyams. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The inscription engraved in front of his body\nstates that he is \u201cThe Great of Punt, Parehu\u201d. The left ankle of the chief,\nParehu, is covered with a bracing ring.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-jb4eHktfhS0/WSrlF_ZVnvI/AAAAAAABTz0/uHUPB4HhqHsu8FF55RVXLSycVsSr32KVgCLcB/s1600/09c468619FF2c5e0c32e4c516dd7e1baa.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"239\" data-original-width=\"378\" height=\"404\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-jb4eHktfhS0/WSrlF_ZVnvI/AAAAAAABTz0/uHUPB4HhqHsu8FF55RVXLSycVsSr32KVgCLcB/s640/09c468619FF2c5e0c32e4c516dd7e1baa.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hatshepsut built the\nlargest, best preserved and&nbsp; most\nimpressive temple at the site, her Mortuary Temple named Djeser-Djeseru (\u201cHoly\nof Holies\u201d), best-preserved of the three complexes. After her death her temple\nwas vandalized by Thuthmosis II and then by Akhenaten<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The story of\nHatshepsut\u2019s expedition to the Land of Punt is recorded for posterity in the\nEgyptian art on the wall of her memorial temple at Deir el-Bahari<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-Xut6MiSgQqo/WSrmteerbGI/AAAAAAABT0Q/80AMtxVbN0UsrM8pXhR_IMpS7SevP-EVQCLcB/s1600/SoPPmalia.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"650\" data-original-width=\"963\" height=\"430\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-Xut6MiSgQqo/WSrmteerbGI/AAAAAAABT0Q/80AMtxVbN0UsrM8pXhR_IMpS7SevP-EVQCLcB/s640/SoPPmalia.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Queen Hatshepsut is a\ndaughter of Thothmes I, third Pharaoh of the Eighteenth Dynasty, and of his\nwife, Queen Ahmes Nefertari. &nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Below: You ca see Aloe Vera and coconut trees-- they grow wild in Kerala</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-y2oUFy60pjw/WSrm6YFEUyI/AAAAAAABT0U/hJi5dOppsRA0TBvbJhk5R-JcnupVyCPCwCLcB/s1600/relieUf-depicts-incense.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"610\" data-original-width=\"610\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-y2oUFy60pjw/WSrm6YFEUyI/AAAAAAABT0U/hJi5dOppsRA0TBvbJhk5R-JcnupVyCPCwCLcB/s640/relieUf-depicts-incense.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">She\ninherited sovereign rights in virtue of her maternal descent from the old\nTwelfth Dynasty line. &nbsp;&nbsp;North Kerala &nbsp;is a matriarchal society<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-YP_TjxoXbgE/WSrmklYzgfI/AAAAAAABT0M/2IH58EqDNm4zH-LAR_NNSVZUihQKq-pdgCLcB/s1600/Egyptian-expeditiNNon_0.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"409\" data-original-width=\"610\" height=\"428\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-YP_TjxoXbgE/WSrmklYzgfI/AAAAAAABT0M/2IH58EqDNm4zH-LAR_NNSVZUihQKq-pdgCLcB/s640/Egyptian-expeditiNNon_0.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Punt came to hold a\ndeep fascination for the Egyptian people as a \"land of plenty\". Even\ntoday if there is a LAND OF PLENTY on this planet, it is Kerala alone.&nbsp; Our social indicators are better than USA,\nEurope and Scandinavia <o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-qIOYeMiL_ic/WSrmfZQqOPI/AAAAAAABT0I/iYuJ_VjRdXs4u7fjT84ToR4SL7be-AQqACLcB/s1600/hatshepsut-teRRmple-layout.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"664\" data-original-width=\"700\" height=\"606\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-qIOYeMiL_ic/WSrmfZQqOPI/AAAAAAABT0I/iYuJ_VjRdXs4u7fjT84ToR4SL7be-AQqACLcB/s640/hatshepsut-teRRmple-layout.png\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The roots of the\nincense trees brought back from Punt by Hatshepsut\u2019s expedition in 1493 BC can\nstill be seen outside of her complex at Deir al-Bahari.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Frankincense tree\ntransplant was so successful the trees flourished in Egypt for centuries. The\nroots of the frankincense trees brought back from Punt by Hatshepsut\u2019s\nexpedition in 1493 BCE can still be seen outside of her complex at Deir\nal-Bahri.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Inscriptions on the walls of\nthe site detail the Egyptian relationship with Punt and make clear that it was\na mutually beneficial one and both parties held the other in deep respect.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-3pjSJ_VHLNo/WSrl5h-YFFI/AAAAAAABTz8/yQ2owErorKQ_oUZrsZIPdc8AeCHxifOAQCLcB/s1600/imFFFages.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"192\" data-original-width=\"263\" height=\"467\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-3pjSJ_VHLNo/WSrl5h-YFFI/AAAAAAABTz8/yQ2owErorKQ_oUZrsZIPdc8AeCHxifOAQCLcB/s640/imFFFages.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A deeper association,\nhowever, sprang from the belief that the gods who blessed Egypt had an equal\naffection for Punt. Imhotel the 9th avatar of Vishnu ( Ayyappa ) came from\nPunt. He commands this planet\u2019s N 1 pilgrimage \u2013attended by 100 millions\npilgrims<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Queen Hatshepsut\nclaimed Hathor ( Ra\u2019s mother ) came from Punt. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-0z1cMrv8dB8/WSroFwl3h1I/AAAAAAABT0g/qNpaJY2rpoAoh6PWfv0nw74BtTbUS05ewCLcB/s1600/220pssx-Hathor.svg.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"519\" data-original-width=\"220\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-0z1cMrv8dB8/WSroFwl3h1I/AAAAAAABT0g/qNpaJY2rpoAoh6PWfv0nw74BtTbUS05ewCLcB/s400/220pssx-Hathor.svg.png\" width=\"168\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: white; color: red; font-size: large;\"><b>Anybody who held the KEY TO MERU ( ankh ) was from\nPunt - this is an indication</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: white; color: red; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-jxYm8fuUdvw/WSrooqPQBYI/AAAAAAABT0o/xHajqINynVohxslbwwY4Y6e95hZjgtzagCLcB/s1600/imhotessp-god-of-medicine.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"279\" data-original-width=\"380\" height=\"468\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-jxYm8fuUdvw/WSrooqPQBYI/AAAAAAABT0o/xHajqINynVohxslbwwY4Y6e95hZjgtzagCLcB/s640/imhotessp-god-of-medicine.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c3766051171564740083\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_132M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user\" style=\"font-style: normal; Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2017/05/land-of-punt-ophir-and-sheba-is-north.html?showComment=1495985017387#c7562018589083095334\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">May 28, 2017 at 8:53 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_131MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\">THESE ARE MUNIYARAS&nbsp;</span></b><br />\n<b><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br />WE HAVE PLENTY OF IT IN KERALA.</span></b><br />\n<br />\nMOST DISAPPEARED DURING BRITISH RULE<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: blue;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2011/12/stonehenge-of-arkaim-russia-capt-ajit.html</span><br />\nKOREA HAS PLENTY OF IT-- IT IS ALL AROUND THE PLANET --ALL SAGES FROM INDIA<br />\n<br />\n###########<br />\n<br />\nCapt. Ajit Vadakayil<br />\nSeptember 20, 2016 at 7:36 PM<br />\n<br />\nSomebody asked me about burial of Jivan Mukhts being BURIED .<br />\n<br />\nSORRY\u2014<br />\n<br />\nWE NEVER BURIED OUR JIVAN MUKHTS UNDER THE GROUND .<br />\n<br />\nWE INTERNED THEM ABOVE THE GROUND IN A MUNIYARA ( WE CALL DOLMENS MUNIYARAS ).<br />\n<br />\nTHEY WERE INTERNED IN YOGA NIDRA POSITON .<br />\n<br />\nMuniyaras are dolmens ( burial chambers ) made of four stones placed on edge and covered by a fifth stone called the cap stone<br />\n<br />\nWhen the white invader came to India we had more than 5000 muniyaras in Kerala alone \u2013 all of them on mountain tops of Western Ghats. Today there are just 400 muniyaras in Kerala\u2014ones which were NOT noticed by the white invader.<br />\n<br />\nhttps://www.tripadvisor.in/Attraction_Review-g303881-d1371324-Reviews-Muniyara_Dolmens-Munnar_Idukki_District_Kerala.html#photos;geo=303881&amp;detail=1371324<br />\n<br />\nThe white BASTARDS took away these huge slabs of granite by breaking them into pieces. This was an EXTREME form of cultural terrorism, because Europe , Russia , Korea, and the world over were full of Dolmens\u2014of Druids ( ancient Hindu sages )<br />\n<br />\nhttp://ancients-bg.com/dolmens-menhirs-cromlechs-the-magical-stones/<br />\n<br />\nBefore 7000 BC, India ruled the whole world ,and there was only ONE religion<br />\n<br />\nHINDUS NEVER EVER BURIED ANYBODY UNDER THE GROUND\u2014VEERASHAIVA LINGAYATHS ( CREATED BY JEW ROTHSCHILD ) PLEASE NOTE<br />\n<br />\nhttp://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/03/st-patrick-genocide-of-druids-pope-leo.html<br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n</li>\n</span></ol>\n<span id=\"bc_0_132b+seedIf2aD\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n<span id=\"bc_0_132b+seedIf2aD\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Anthropologists have\nfrequently drawn attention to the similarity in the appearance of the skulls of\nthe Hindu races of India and the Early Egyptians <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">WE CREMATE AND HENCE\nSKULLS ARE NOT PRESERVED<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">OUR 12 STRAND DNA DANAVA\nMAHARISHIS HAD LARGE HEADS TO ACCOMMODATE A KING SIZED PINEAL GLAND. THEY WERE rH\n&nbsp;NEGATIVE BLOOD GROUPS.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; I&nbsp; AM\nrH negative.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Land of Punt is\nroutinely praised for its riches and the \"goodness of the land\" by\nEgyptian scribes.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">North Kerala has the most\nfertile land on this planet<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-rlE7HEx74TM/WSurgNGaOlI/AAAAAAABT2s/7oeX3Wt1B885VXcZYMYldYarf-YjNYLEwCLcB/s1600/mERaxresdefault.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"900\" data-original-width=\"1600\" height=\"360\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-rlE7HEx74TM/WSurgNGaOlI/AAAAAAABT2s/7oeX3Wt1B885VXcZYMYldYarf-YjNYLEwCLcB/s640/mERaxresdefault.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hatshepsut's\ninscriptions claim that her divine mother, Hathor, was from Punt and other\ninscriptions indicate that Egyptians in the 18th Dynasty considered Punt the\norigin of their culture</span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When Hatshepsut\nreturned to Egypt , she built a temple patterned after the one she had seen in\nPunt. She even referred to the construction as building a \u201cPunt\u201d; and the\nreliefs on one wall were devoted to describing the trips to Punt.&nbsp;&nbsp; The temple was called \u201cThe Most Splendid of\nSplendors\u201d and the remains are still located at Deir el-Bahari near\nThebes.&nbsp; The architecture does not fit\nthe standard traditional Egyptian style. &nbsp;Temples are found in Kerala NOT in Africa \u2013 pleaJJe.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Amenhotep III once\nsaid,&nbsp; \u201cWhen I look to the sunrise, I\ncome to the countries of Punt\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">On Dec 29, 2009,\narchaeologists found the eighth in a series of lost chambers at Wadi Gawasis in\nEgypt. Previously seven chambers had revealed pieces of an Egyptian sea faring\nvessel.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Inside they found a\nnetwork of larger rooms filled with dozens of nautical artifacts: limestone\nanchors, 80 coils of knotted rope, pottery fragments, ship timbers, and two\ncurved cedar planks that likely are steering oars from a 70-foot-long ship.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">According to hieroglyphic inscriptions, the ship was dispatched to the southern\nRed Sea port of Punt by Queen Hatshepsut during the 15th century B.C.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The site chosen by\nHatshepsut for her temple was the product of precise strategic calculations: it\nwas situated not only in a valley considered sacred for over 500 years to the\nprincipal feminine goddess connected with the funeral world, but also on the\naxis of the temple of Amun of Karnak, and finally, it stood at a distance of\nonly a few hundred meters in a straight line from the tomb that the queen had\nordered excavated for herself in the Valley of the Kings on the other side of\nthe mountain<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Wooden cargo boxes\nlabeled \u201cwonderful things of Punt\u201d, which were discovered at Mersa Gawasis, the\nancient Egyptian port of Saww..&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-pyWwDlFl_Zs/WSsG2xUTCII/AAAAAAABT04/GiA5ChyRxKEZYrFKevKVSB317Beb7rs2QCLcB/s1600/image-04-srrmall.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"295\" data-original-width=\"200\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-pyWwDlFl_Zs/WSsG2xUTCII/AAAAAAABT04/GiA5ChyRxKEZYrFKevKVSB317Beb7rs2QCLcB/s640/image-04-srrmall.jpg\" width=\"433\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">They found an ancient ship rudder made of Teak\nwood and stout coir ropes , which are found abundantly &nbsp;in Kerala.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-WZOunQUsNwQ/WSsG98be8iI/AAAAAAABT08/bzNkOSwHex42-X4wS6OV0hxaKsqeQp_xgCLcB/s1600/cairo.2B2rope.gif\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"568\" data-original-width=\"436\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-WZOunQUsNwQ/WSsG98be8iI/AAAAAAABT08/bzNkOSwHex42-X4wS6OV0hxaKsqeQp_xgCLcB/s640/cairo.2B2rope.gif\" width=\"490\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mersa Gawasis (Ancient\nEgyptian Saww) is a small Egyptian harbour on the Red Sea and a former Egyptian\nport city. The harbour lies at the mouth of Wadi Gawasis, 2 km south of the\nmouth of Wadi Gasus. 25 km north is the city of Safaga and 50 km south\nal-Qusair.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Saww could now be clearly\nidentified with Mersa Gawasis and that in the Middle Kingdom the ships sailed\nfrom here to Punt and back&nbsp; . &nbsp;110\nkg ship spare anchors were found in Mersa Gawasis&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In 2004, archaeological\nexcavations led by the Egyptologists Kathryn Bard and Rodolfo Fattovich at\nMersa Gawasis in Egypt identified this harbor as the old port of Saww, which\nthe ancient Egyptians used during their expeditions to Punt.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The diggers found\na number of commodities at the site that may have been brought back from Punt,\nincluding fragments of carbonized ebony wood . The researchers also discovered\nactual shipbuilding materials dating to the Middle Kingdom, such as anchors,\ntimbers and huge steering oars, as well as 26 well-preserved coils of vessel-rigging\nrope that were lying on the floors of a cave.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-ROKuV__8EEo/WSurRQjqk3I/AAAAAAABT2o/rQwpGZxfcegZMT1NxStxLQC_5sPaH-tiQCLcB/s1600/400px-S_F-EG-CAMERON_2006-10-EGYPT-WESTBANK-0153.JPG\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"600\" data-original-width=\"400\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-ROKuV__8EEo/WSurRQjqk3I/AAAAAAABT2o/rQwpGZxfcegZMT1NxStxLQC_5sPaH-tiQCLcB/s640/400px-S_F-EG-CAMERON_2006-10-EGYPT-WESTBANK-0153.JPG\" width=\"426\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Most intriguingly, they came upon\n43 cargo boxes from the reign of Pharaoh Amenemhat IV (r. 1990\u20131800 BCE). Two\nof these boxes were engraved with a package label, which had been recorded by\nthe scribe Djedy; it included inscriptions for his name, a cartouche of\nAmenemhat IV and regnal Year 8, and the phrase \u201cwonderful things of Punt\u201d in\nhieroglyphics.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The cargo boxes were all empty since their contents, which are\nbelieved to have included frankincense, were apparently unloaded into\ncontainers or bags for later transport via caravan across the Eastern Desert.\nAdditionally,&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Bard found a limestone stela with hieroglyphic text on it that\ncommemorates two royal maritime expeditions to Punt and Bia-Punt (\u201cMine(s) of\nPunt\u201d) during the reign of Pharaoh Amenemhet III (r. 1831\u20131786 BCE).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Wooden cargo boxes\nlabeled \u201cwonderful things of Punt\u201d, which were discovered at Mersa Gawasis, the\nancient Egyptian port of Saww<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-rl-wKJNYJKA/WSsMdBXNskI/AAAAAAABT1M/ApPPwKBYcLoQD_d5GTzIOoQ8WPkwDcZ6ACLcB/s1600/dowFnload.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"246\" data-original-width=\"205\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-rl-wKJNYJKA/WSsMdBXNskI/AAAAAAABT1M/ApPPwKBYcLoQD_d5GTzIOoQ8WPkwDcZ6ACLcB/s640/dowFnload.jpg\" width=\"533\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A stela that was\ndiscovered at Wadi Gawasis (Wadi Gasus) provides an answer. Erected by\nKhentkhetwer, an official under the Twelfth Dynasty Pharaoh Amenemhet II or\nNubkaure (r. 1922\u20131878 BCE), it contains an engraving that explicitly\nidentifies Saww as the port where Khentkhetwer and his men arrived after their\nvoyage to Punt. The Khentkhetwer stela inscription reads:--</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Giving divine praise\nand laudation to Horus, to Min of Coptos, by the hereditary prince, count,\nwearer of the royal seal, the master of the judgement-hall Khentkhetwer[\u2026]\nafter his arrival in safety from Punt; his army being with him, prosperous and\nhealthy and his ships having landed at Sewew (Saww). Year 28.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-kLz5Q7Uuxow/WSurIFJTtxI/AAAAAAABT2k/wK0-sNfwhnkvJX30zMW0_w8MyHx9I6rwACLcB/s1600/Relief-of-HaHHHtshepsut-and-thutmose-ii.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"300\" data-original-width=\"400\" height=\"480\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-kLz5Q7Uuxow/WSurIFJTtxI/AAAAAAABT2k/wK0-sNfwhnkvJX30zMW0_w8MyHx9I6rwACLcB/s640/Relief-of-HaHHHtshepsut-and-thutmose-ii.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">That the ancient\nEgyptians journeyed to and from Punt through a Red Sea route, and via the old\nport of Saww in particular, has thus been confirmed.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Berenice (Berenike)\nalso known as Baranis, is an ancient seaport of Egypt on the west coast of the\nRed Sea. It is situated about 825 km south of Suez and 260 km east of Aswan in\nUpper Egypt.&nbsp; Berenice was quite famous\nand prosperous in antiquity. The city is noted by most ancient Greek students\nboarding Calicut King\u2019s ships to travel to Kerala Kodungllaur Univeristy.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The road across the\ndesert from Coptos was 258 Roman miles long, or eleven days' journey. The road\nwas provided with watering stations&nbsp; the\nwells and halting boarding lodgings&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The archaeologist John\nBimson indicates that early Egyptian hieroglyphs included a pictogram of a\none-horned rhinoceros which is found only in India<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Quuen hatshepsit\u2019s &nbsp;temple reliefs show that each of the 31 heavy\nincense trees required 4 to 6 men to transport them to the cargo ships, or 124\nto 186 Egyptian and Puntite carriers in total. Since there were around 150\ncrewmen on the expedition\u2019s five vessels (30 per ship) and huge amounts of\nfertile top soil.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The walls of the great\ntemple in Karnak depicted the story of an expedition of impressive ships to the\nmysterious land known as Punt. The fleet of Queen Hatshepsut traveled there to\nher ancestral land<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hatshepsut lived during\none of the most magnificent periods in the history of Egypt, when the country\nwas powerful and the treasury of the royal palaces were full of gold.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-R2c1vc0Drpk/WSurASNpR4I/AAAAAAABT2g/rlhz3_uPUFoCN-1jm4cYkM7YgL8jjALJwCLcB/s1600/templBBe-of-hatshepsut.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"366\" data-original-width=\"550\" height=\"424\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-R2c1vc0Drpk/WSurASNpR4I/AAAAAAABT2g/rlhz3_uPUFoCN-1jm4cYkM7YgL8jjALJwCLcB/s640/templBBe-of-hatshepsut.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Hatshepsut was the\nlongest reigning female pharaoh. Under her reign, Egypt prospered. Known as\n\u201cThe Woman Who Was King,\u201d the Egyptian economy flourished during her time as\npharaoh. She directed the construction and repairs of many buildings,\nmemorials, and temples.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">However, upon her death, her successors tried to erase\nany memory of her. While the goal may have been to eradicate her from memory,\nthese attempts only fueled the desire of modern civilizations to know more\nabout her. More than 3,000 years after her death, archaeologists were intrigued\nand mystified as they attempted to locate and identify her remains.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Born in 1508 BC,\nHatshepsut was the only child born to Egyptian king Thutmose I and his\nprincipal wife and queen, Ahmose. When Hatshepsut was twelve years old, her\nfather passed away. She married her half-brother Thutmose II, and assumed the\nrole of principal wife and queen.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">She\nremained Thutmose II\u2019s queen until he passed away fifteen years later, leaving\nHatshepsut a widow at age 27. Hatshepsut and Thutmose II had one child together\n\u2013 a daughter named Neferure.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Thutmose II also had a son, Thutmose III, born to\na concubine. Thutmose III was an infant upon Thutmose II\u2019s death, so Hatshepsut\nserved as his regent. Eventually, she stepped up and assumed the role of\npharaoh.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-LYZJXPQrXz4/WSuq1ACHKeI/AAAAAAABT2c/bC7sOBmX8LIaox-Un7AZ2zkgJ-l1tqfPACLcB/s1600/punt_india_eRRgypt1.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"313\" data-original-width=\"391\" height=\"512\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-LYZJXPQrXz4/WSuq1ACHKeI/AAAAAAABT2c/bC7sOBmX8LIaox-Un7AZ2zkgJ-l1tqfPACLcB/s640/punt_india_eRRgypt1.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Around 1437 BC, she had\nherself crowned as pharaoh, changing her name from the female version\nHatshepsut - which means Foremost of the Noble Ladies - to the male version,\nHatshepsu. She was also responsible for the first recorded attempt to\ntransplant foreign trees, when she brought thirty-one live myrrh trees from\nPunt.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;She commissioned hundreds of building projects throughout Upper Egypt and\nLower Egypt. Her buildings were considered to be much grander than those of her\npredecessors, and many of her successors attempted to claim them as their\nown.&nbsp; Hatshepsut\u2019s greatest building\naccomplishment was a mortuary temple built in a complex at Deir el-Bahri,\nlocated on the West bank of the Nile.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is considered one of the\narchitectural marvels of ancient Egypt. Twenty-two years after taking her reign\nas pharaoh, in around 1458 BC, Hatshepsut died, aged in her late 40s. She was\nburied in a tomb in the Valley of the Kings, in the hills behind Deir el-Bahri.\nShe had her father\u2019s sarcophagus relocated into her tomb as well, so they could\nlie together in death.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">After her passing, Thutmose III, Hatshepsut\u2019s stepson,\nclaimed the role of pharaoh, ruling for 30 years beyond Hatshepsut\u2019s death. It\nwas Thutmose III who demanded that evidence of Hatshepsut\u2019s rule be eradicated.\nHe arranged for her image as pharaoh to be removed from temples and monuments.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is likely that Thutmose III wanted to remove any evidence that they had been\nled by a strong female ruler. For this reason, scholars knew very little of\nHatshepsut\u2019s existence prior to 1822 AD, when the hieroglyphics on the walls of\nDeir el-Bahri were decoded.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Remains of Pharaoh\nQueen Hatshepsut Identified (28/05/07): A DNA test of a single tooth was key to\nsolving one of the greatest mysteries of ancient Egypt.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span><br />\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c3867925024763912742\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; Am i right?</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_167BR\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; margin-left: 36px; margin-top: 1em;\">\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<span id=\"bc_0_167b+seedI3wAD\" kind=\"d\"></span><br /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-thread inline-thread\" id=\"bc_0_166T\" kind=\"t\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee;
