font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Through the 78 days of\nbombing, negotiations continued, each side making compromises\u2014. NATO abandoned\nits most extreme demands, including those that had apparently undermined the\nnegotations at the last minute and the wording that had been interpreted as\ncalling for a referendum on independence.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Serbia agreed to an \u201cinternational security presence with substantial\nNATO participation,\u201d the sole mention of NATO in the peace agreement or\nSecurity Council Resolution 1244 affirming it.&nbsp;&nbsp;\nNATO had no intention of living up to the scraps of paper it had signed,\nand moved at once to violate them, implementing a military occupation of Kosovo\nunder NATO command.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When Serbia and\nRussia insisted on the terms of the formal agreements, they were castigated for\ntheir deceit, and bombing was renewed to bring them to heel.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">On June 7 199, NATO planes again bombed the\noil refineries in Novi Sad and Pancevo. The Pancevo refinery burst into flames,\nreleasing a huge cloud of toxic fumes.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The bombing was not reported by kosher\nmedia whores.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Clinton\nadministration's Bosnian intervention had resulted in the \u201cDayton Accord,\u201d an\nagreement meant to create peace by dividing the state of Bosnia Herzegovina\ninto the mainly Bosnian/Croat Muslim Federation of Bosnia-Herzegovina, and the\nSerbian, mainly Christian, Republika Srpska.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">While the agreement\nbrought peace after three and half years of fighting, it created a\ndysfunctional state controlled by foreign capital, which suffered from one of\nthe highest unemployment rates in the world and regular outbursts of\nnationalist tension.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The General Framework\nAgreement for Peace in Bosnia and Herzegovina, also known as the Dayton\nAgreement, Dayton Accords&nbsp; is the peace\nagreement reached at&nbsp; United States and\nformally signed in Paris on 14 December 1995. These accords put an end to the\n\u200a3 1\u20442-year-long Bosnian War, one of the Yugoslav Wars.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">On 13 February 2008,\nthe head of the Presidency of Bosnia-Herzegovina \u017deljko Kom\u0161i\u0107 said that the\noriginal Dayton Agreement was lost from the Presidency's archive. On 16\nNovember 2009 the French Foreign Ministry delivered the certified \u201cdoctored \u201c\ncopy of the Dayton agreement to the French embassy in Sarajevo.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Dayton Agreement\nwere cooked up 4 years before at Bilderberg Club ..&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Enlargement of the North\nAtlantic Treaty Organization (NATO) is the process of including new member\nstates in NATO. NATO is essentially a private army of Jew Rothschild--a\nmilitary alliance of twenty-six European and two North American countries that\nconstitutes a system of collective defense\u2014in front of the screen.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In 2011,\nNATO officially recognized 3 aspiring members: Bosnia and Herzegovina, Georgia,\nand Montenegro. Montenegro's membership is on track to be complete by 5th June\n2017<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Dayton Agreement\nended the Bosnian War and created the federal republic of Bosnia and\nHerzegovina (BiH), made up of two entities, the Bosniak and Croat-inhabited\nFederation of Bosnia and Herzegovina (FBiH), and the Serb-inhabited Republika\nSrpska (RS).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Serbian\nintellectuals rejected the&nbsp; the Dayton\nAgreement, as they considered that Milosevic had yielded under pressure, and\nthat the Serbs had lost \u2018ethnic\u2019 territory in the Bosnian Krajina.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Serbian Orthodox\nChurch (SPC) synod was the most vocal of all in opposing the Dayton Agreement\nand, in an appeal to the international community, maintained that the signature\nof the Patriarch should be considered void<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vojislav Seselj , the\npresident of the Serbian Radical Party (SRS).stated that the so-called peace\nagreement signed at Dayton represents confirmation of the Serb defeat, and that ---</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cthe Serb people will never be able to accept such hysterical anti-Serb\npolicies as those of Milosevic and the international community as final, and a\nfuture democratic and nationally-oriented authority will certainly know how to\nfulfil the aspirations of our people to live in a united and strong Serb\nstate\u201d.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Dayton accords was\nimperfect \u2014 notably in establishing a weak central government and two\nquasi-autonomous, gerrymandered entities within Bosnia: One entity was a\nfederation of Bosnian Muslims and ethnic Croats; the other a statelet run by\nBosnian Serbs<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The U.S. and Europeans\nsupported creation of Bosnia and Herzegovina (divided among Muslims, ethnic\nSerbs, and ethnic Croats) and Croatia (with a large ethnic Serb population in\nthe Krajina region). However, after encouraging the break-up of Yugoslavia, the\nallies suddenly opposed secession of ethnic Croats and Serbs from Bosnia and\nethnic Serbs from Croatia.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">US&nbsp; expected ethnic Serb minorities to politely\nsuffer under other ethnic majorities, even when faced with ethnic cleansing.\nFor instance, Croatia, buttressed by U.S. aid, launched a large-scale military\noffensive against the Krajina Serbs, causing hundreds of thousands to flee.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In\nUSAs eyes Catholic Croats and Albanian crypto jew Muslims could do no wrong..\nNATO entered the war, despite the absence of any security threat to America or\nEurope.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Milosevic government responded by expelling thousands of ethnic\nAlbanians. After the victorious allies ousted Serb security forces, the\ntriumphant ethnic Albanian Kosovars launched their own campaign of ethnic\ncleansing, kicking out around a quarter of a million Serbs, Roma, and others.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The U.S. and Europeans, though occupying the territory, did little. A few years\nlater another round of ethnic Albanian violence drove many of the remaining\nethnic Serbs into camps or to Kosovo\u2019s north, in which a majority of residents\nwere ethnic Serbs.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pristina acquired a dubious reputation, essentially a\ngangster statelet ruled by war criminals. It was a black hole for organized\ncrime, where Saudi Arabia, in particular, underwrote efforts to radicalize\nheretofore moderate and secular Muslims.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Criminal mafia state&nbsp; Kosovo has\nnot earned the right to hold ethnic Serbs in political bondage. Crimes against\nnon-ethnic Albanians are rarely prosecuted. The courts suffer from political\ninterference and bribery.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In 2008 the U.S. and most European nations dropped\nthe pretense of diplomacy by recognizing the Republic of Kosovo.&nbsp;&nbsp; The continuing injustice inflicted on ethnic\nSerbs in north Kosovo creates needless instability and risk of conflict</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Dayton accords\nlocked in place the ethnic hostilities that fueled the war, which began in 1992\namid the post-Cold War breakup of the former Yugoslavia.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This ulterior\nmotived&nbsp; accord allowed the once-warring\nparties \u2014 the Bosnian Muslims, ethnic Croats, and ethnic Serbs \u2014 to keep in\nplace their respective armies.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Dayton Accords are\nan unsustainable peace arrangement, created by immature and non-perceptive men\n--the only principle being&nbsp; that the\nSerbs always lose.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Four years later, in\n1999, President Clinton decided to launch a second war on Yugoslavia under the\npretense of stopping Serbian president Slobodan Milosevic's \"ethnic\ncleansing\" of Albanians in the province of Kosovo.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Despite the United\nNations later ruling the alleged \u201cgenocide\u201d never took place, Clinton strongly\nsupported the Albanians and their Kosovo Liberation Army (KLA) in their fight\nagainst Yugoslav forces.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The targets included\ncivilian buildings such as monasteries, factories, television stations,\nhospitals and schools.The intervention, which was never approved by the UN,\ndevastated Yugoslavia, killed thousands of civilians and was strongly opposed\nby both Russia and China.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The end of the war did\nnot mean the end of the Clinton administration's involvement in the area. As\nsecretary of state, Hillary Clinton said Kosovo is a personal matter for her.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cFor me, my family and\nmy fellow Americans this is more than a foreign policy issue, it is personal,\u201d\nClinton stressed.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Russian and Yugoslavian\nofficials were negotiating the issue of Russia\u2019s debt to Yugoslavia in\n1996-1997. The latter had a chance to receive anti-missile S-300 complexes as\ndebt payment. The Serbs declined the offer. The rest is history. - <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Russia's \u2013nay\u2014Boris Yeltsin\u2019s decision on June\n3, 1999 to back the West and to urge President Milo\u0161evi\u0107 to surrender was the\nsingle event that had \"the greatest significance in ending the war\".&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\">The Yugoslav capitulation came the same day.&nbsp;\nRussia relied on Western economic aid at the time, which made it\nvulnerable to pressure from NATO to withdraw support for Milo\u0161evi\u0107. Russia was\nguilty of Yugoslavia\u2019s collapse.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"></span></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">After Milosevic was\nextradited from Yugoslavia in 2001 to face trial at The Hague, Netherlands, the\ncountry received around $1 billion in financial aid. &nbsp; &nbsp;</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-size: large;\">We don\u2019t know what personal benefits USA gave Yeltsin.</span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Milosevic had been\nhoping that the Russians under Yeltsin would intervene to defend Yugoslavia\nagainst NATO. Eventually he was told by them that this would not happen, and\nthat he'd better settle for what he could get, which included a cease-fire\nunder United Nations auspices and a pledge that Kosovo would remain part of\nYugoslavia.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\">Moscow put pressure on Milosevic and pushed\nhim towards capitulation. &nbsp; It is worthy of note that NATO was about to end the\nmilitary operations over the pressure from the general public. It is obvious\nthat Rothschild twisted&nbsp; Boris Yeltsins\u2019\narm.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Breakup of\nYugoslavia and the Dissolution of the Soviet Union happened simultaneously. As\na result, diplomatic relations between the newly formed Federal Republic of\nYugoslavia and Russia were slow to materialize.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">On 23 March 2008 Vladimir Putin\nordered urgent humanitarian aid for Kosovo Serb enclaves.&nbsp; Prime Minister of Kosovo,&nbsp; criminal Hashim Thaci, opposed the Russian\nplan for sending aid to Kosovo Serbs<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">After the 1999 war\nKosovo received $4.1 billion of international aid. Between 2000 and 2010 the\nregion received up to $44 billion.&nbsp;&nbsp; Much\nmore money has been received to be secretly&nbsp;\nsiphoned off to Albanian mercenaries who are targeting President Assad\nof Syria<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Yugoslav\ncapitulation occurred on the same day that U.S. President Bill Clinton held a\nwidely publicized meeting with his four service chiefs to discuss options for a\nunited nations ground-force deployment in case the air war failed<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">On March 23, 1999\nRichard Holbrooke returned to Brussels and announced that peace talks had\nfailed.&nbsp;&nbsp; On March 23, 1999 at 22:17 UTC\nthe Secretary General of NATO, Javier Solana, announced he had directed the\nSupreme Allied Commander Europe (SACEUR), General Wesley Clark, to\n\"initiate air operations in the Federal Republic of Yugoslavia.\"&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; On March 24 at 19:00 UTC NATO started the\nbombing campaign against Yugoslavia.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">NATO's bombing campaign\ninvolved more than 1100 aircraft operating from air bases in Italy and Germany,\nand the aircraft carrier USS Theodore Roosevelt stationed in the Adriatic\nSea.&nbsp;&nbsp; F/A-18 Hornets of the Spanish Air\nForce were the first NATO planes to bomb Belgrade and perform SEAD\noperations.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Suppression of Enemy\nAir Defenses (SEAD), also known as \"Wild Weasel\" and \"Iron\nHand\" operations in the United States, are military actions to suppress\nenemy surface-based air defenses, including not only surface-to-air missiles\n(SAMs) and anti-aircraft artillery (AAA) but also interrelated systems such as\nearly-warning radar and command, control and communication (C3) functions,\nwhile also marking other targets to be destroyed by an air strike.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Suppression\ncan be accomplished both by physically destroying the systems or by disrupting\nand deceiving them through electronic warfare.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In modern warfare SEAD missions\ncan constitute as much as 30% of all sorties launched in the first week of\ncombat and continue at a reduced rate through the rest of a campaign. One\nquarter of American combat sorties in recent conflicts have been SEAD missions.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">BGM-109 Tomahawk cruise\nmissiles were fired from ships and submarines. The U.S. was the dominant member\nof the coalition against Yugoslavia, although other NATO members were involved.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">During the ten weeks of the conflict, NATO aircraft flew over 38,000 combat\nmissions. For the German Air Force, this mission was its first conflict participation\nsince World War II. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">NATO naval forces\noperated in the Adriatic Sea. The Royal Navy sent a substantial task force that\nincluded the aircraft carrier HMS Invincible, which operated Sea Harrier FA2\nfighter jets.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The RN also deployed destroyers and frigates, and the Royal Fleet\nAuxiliary (RFA) provided support vessels, including the aviation\ntraining/primary casualty receiving ship RFA Argus.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It was the first time the\nRN used cruise missiles in combat, operated from the nuclear fleet submarine\nHMS Splendid. The Italian Navy provided a naval task force that included the\naircraft carrier Giuseppe Garibaldi, a frigate (Maestrale) and a submarine\n(Sauro-class).&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The United States Navy provided a naval task force that included\nthe aircraft carrier USS Theodore Roosevelt, USS Vella Gulf, and the amphibious\nassault ship USS Kearsarge.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The French Navy provided the aircraft carrier Foch\nand escorts. The German Navy deployed the frigate Rheinland-Pfalz and Oker, an\nOste-class fleet service ship, in the naval operations.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In April 1999, during\nthe NATO bombing, officials in Yugoslavia said the damage from the bombing\ncampaign has cost around $100 billion up to that time.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Yugoslav President\nMilo\u0161evi\u0107 survived the 78 day intense bombing &nbsp;and declared its outcome a major victory for\nYugoslavia. He was, however, indicted for war crimes by the International\nCriminal Tribunal for the Former Yugoslavia<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In December 2002,\nElizabeth II approved the awarding of the Battle Honour \"Kosovo\" to\nsquadrons of the RAF that participated in the conflict.&nbsp;&nbsp; This was also extended to the Canadian\nsquadrons deployed to the operation<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Every Jewish\norganistaion in USA/ Europe&nbsp; lobbied for\nand ran ads in favor the NATO bombing campaign.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Israel aided NATO's intervention effort, by\ncontributing drones to the bombing effort ( in favor of Albanian Muslims ) and\nproviding medical assistance<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kangaroo court ICJ\nvote&nbsp; determined that the NATO bombing\nwas an instance of \u201chumanitarian intervention\" and thus did not violate\nArticle 9 of the Genocide Convention.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Years on, Serbia still\nbears deep scars of the NATO bombings &nbsp;&nbsp;..NATO has never revealed its own&nbsp; losses.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Instead of trying a\nmyriad of peaceful options, war criminals Clinton, Albright, and NATO reached\nfor the old, unreliable one: Send in the bombers. They didn't bother themselves\nwith international law.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">They clearly flouted it. International law clearly\nstates that one country can attack another one only when it is itself under\nattack, about to be attacked, or when the U.N. Security Council grants\npermission. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nor, for that matter,\nwas the bombing in accordance with U.S. law: Article 1, Section 8 of the U.S.\nConstitution grants Congress the sole power to declare war, and there was no\nformal declaration of war in this case.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">US Congress shirked its responsibilities by approving a measure that fell\nshort of a war declaration but supported the President's decision to send in\nthe bombers.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Because Clinton and\nAlbright threatened NATO attacks and Milosevic did not back down like a coward\n, they felt they had to go to war, no matter the costs.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In 1999, the Clinton\nadministration orchestrated a war against the sovereign nation of Serbia.\nClinton justified his actions, by making claims of \u201cgenocide\u201d and&nbsp; LIES of \u201cmass graves\u201d against the Serbian\ngovernment. Those claims have since been proven to be cooked up LIES.</span></div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Balkan wars were a\nbrutal and complex affair, but to Holbrooke and the Clinton administration it\nwas all quite simple: the Serbs must be cut down to size....&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Holbrooke\u2019s\nfavored formula of intimidation and aerial bombardment was applied repeatedly\nto force Belgrade into accommodation of U.S. demands, first to create the\nBosnian state and then to detach Kosovo from Serbia itself in 1999.&nbsp; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The entire style and substance of\nHolbrooke\u2019s work can be distilled to one quality: not compassion, but\naggression., and doctored CNN clips of refugees made for a convenient excuse to\nlaunch cruise missiles against civilian infrastructure.</span></div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is possible to\nidentify two methods by which NATO waged its one-sided war on the civilians of\nSerbia.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Firstly, it took steps to degrade their quality of life and impose\nimmediate hardships on the them. Hardships which were becoming greater as the\nbombing dragged on, but which would come to an end quickly if the war was to\nend.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Secondly, it threatened to intensify and continue the bombing until the\nwhole of Serbian economy lay in ruins for the long term and took steps to convince\nSerbians it was willing to act upon its implicit threat.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Both methods presumed\ndestruction of civilian targets. Both were employed for the purpose of coercing\nthe general population to pressure for termination of war on NATO's terms. As\nsuch they were straightforward examples of naked terrorism.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Using smart bombs, dumb\nbombs, cluster bombs, and bombs incorporating depleted uranium, the bombings in\nthe service of humanitarianism killed&nbsp;\nthousands of innocent civilian&nbsp;\nmen, women, and children; it struck factories, waterworks,\nelectricworks, TV and radio facilities, bridges, trains, and ordinary houses,\nto say nothing of the Chinese Embassy. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The bombing was an act\nin flagrant contempt of international law, and criminal under that law.\nRotshchild\u2019s media ignored it <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">NATO, was formed\noriginally as a defensive alliance under the UN Charter. The North Atlantic\nTreaty at its outset pledged its signatories to refrain from the threat or use\nof force in any manner inconsistent with the purposes of the United Nations,\nand it explicitly recognized the primary responsibility of the Security Council\n(of the United Nations) for the maintenance of international peace and security<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The popular narrative\nis that is that the Western powers dropped these bombs out of humanitarian\nconcern, but this claim falls apart once the distorted lens of Western\nsaviourism is dropped and actual facts are presented.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In truth, NATO intervention in Yugoslavia\nwas predicated on the imperialist, colonialist economic and ideological\ninterests of the NATO states, masquerading for the public as a humanitarian\neffort, that in fact served to dismantle the last remnant of socialism in\nEurope and recolonize the Balkans.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Milosevic was accused\nby the UN and other leading authorities of war crimes against the people of\nSerbia - and also of trying to enforce a 'Serbian nationalist agenda' to create\na 'stronger' state.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Albanian KLA, once\nidentified as a vicious terrorist organization by the United States, was in\nresponse engaged in ambushing Serb police and administrators, and the Serbs\nwere certainly shooting back in what amounted nevertheless to a low level civil\ninsurrection.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Borders were\nstrategically drawn across artificial ethnographic lines in a process that came\nto be known as \u2018Balkanization\u2019.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Balkanization, or\nBalkanisation, is a pejorative geopolitical term, originally used to describe\nthe process of fragmentation or division of a region or state into smaller\nregions or states that are often hostile or uncooperative with one another.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It means to fracture\nand waste something important, like a country, with something totally\nunimportant, like ethnic differences\u2014 done by Zionist Jews with money making\nulterior motives .</span></div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Yugoslavia was\ntemporarily tolerated by the west as a buffer between the Soviet sphere and\nWestern Europe, but in 1984, the destabilization of Socialist Yugoslavia and\nthe imposition of the market became official U.S policy with National Security\nDecision Directive 133. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>US president must be\ncontrolled by ROTHSCHILDs SHADOW GOVT.&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>Donald Trump will NOT\nbe allowed to do this .<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Presidential_directive\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Presidential_directive</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">After the failure of\nthe Vietnam War, U.S foreign policy avoided direct intervention and instead\nopted for the funding of contras or the imposition of market reforms and \u2018shock\ntherapy\u2019 via U.S dominated institutions such as the World Bank or IMF.&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Fortunately for the US,\nYugoslavia\u2019s \u2018non-aligned\u2019 stance in the Cold War meant it had been taking on\nIMF loans since the end of WWII, and by 1981 the SFRY had racked up nearly $20\nbillion in foreign debt.&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The IMF and World Bank\ndemanded an economic \u2018restructuring\u2019. Neoliberal austerity reforms were imposed\non Yugoslavia \u2013 wages were frozen, state subsidized pricing was abolished,\nworker-managed enterprises were dismantled and social spending was cut. The\nnational wealth was directed towards debt payments as unemployment skyrocketed.\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The economic reforms\n\u201cwreaked economic and political havoc\u2026 Slower growth, the accumulation of\nforeign debt and especially the cost of servicing it as well as devaluation led\nto a fall in the standard of living of the average Yugoslav\u2026 The economic\ncrisis threatened political stability \u2026 it also threatened to aggravate\nsimmering ethnic tensions<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Growth in industrial\nproduction shrank from 7% to negative 10% by 1990 as foreign capital and\nimports flooded the republics, smothering domestic production. In 1989-1990\nalone the World Bank created 600,000 layoffs; an additional hundreds of\nthousands of Yugoslavs worked without pay for months at a time.&nbsp; The IMF froze wages as inflation skyrocketed\nand by early 1990 real wages had dropped 41%.&nbsp;&nbsp;\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Overall the IMF and\nWorld Bank programs greatly undermined the federation and fuelled ethnic\ntensions and secessionist movements which would tear Yugoslavia apart, namely\nby freezing transfer payments from Belgrade to the republics. As the Rothschild\ncontrolled IMF took control of the Central Bank and rendered the federal\ngovernment almost completely powerless, secessionist movements began gaining\ntraction in the republics. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Germany, a NATO member,\ninstigated by Bilderberg Club backed these secessionist movements in Slovenia\nand Croatia. This included arms shipments and training.&nbsp;&nbsp; Slovenia and Croatia were among the richer\nrepublics, and as the IMF imposed economic crisis worsened they became\nincreasingly opposed to having to subsidize the poorer republics. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In 1991 they both\ndeclared independence and were immediately recognized by GermanyThe Krajina\nSerbs inside Croatia made clear that they wished to remain a part of the\nYugoslav federation \u2013 they were not recognized by any NATO members. Tudjman\u2019s\nCroatia followed in the fascist Usta\u0161e\u2019s footsteps and between 1991 and 1995\nthe US backed Croatia drove out half a million Serbs. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In 1992 Macedonia also\ndeclared \u2018independence\u2019 and accepted occupation by US troops. In the same year\nfighting broke out in Bosnia-Herzegovina, where the situation was more\ncomplicated \u2013 no single nationality held a majority. Nonetheless, the United\nStates and Germany backed the Croatian and Bosnian separatists, providing\ntraining and arms, and thus fanning the flames of the conflict<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;
