font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">According to Tim Judah, KLA representatives had already met with American,\nBritish, and Swiss intelligence agencies in 1996, and possibly \"several\nyears earlier\" and according to The Sunday Times, \"American\nintelligence agents have admitted they helped to train the Kosovo Liberation\nArmy before NATO's bombing of Yugoslavia\".&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Carla Del Ponte, a long-time\nICTY chief prosecutor, claimed in her book The Hunt: Me and the War Criminals\nthat there were instances of organ trafficking in 1999 after the end of the\nKosovo War. In late 1999\nthe KLA was disbanded and its members entered the Kosovo Protection Corps.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As noted by Amnesty\nInternational, working as double agents for Jew Rothschild, along with ICJ\nHague , the precise number of civilians who died as a result of NATO air\nattacks is not known.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; Secondly, to\nallow NATO to station 30,000 ground troops in Yugoslavia and, lastly, to allow\na NATO-conducted referendum for Kosovo\u2019s independence from Yugoslavia.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; (MPRI used former U.S. military personnel\nto train KLA forces at secret bases inside Albania</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The MPRI has a starting\nlineup comprised of retired Pentagon top brass. Its roster includes one retired\nadmiral, two retired major generals, and 10 retired generals. The MPRI employed\nmore than 400 personnel and could access the resumes of thousands of former\nU.S. military specialists from cooks and clerks to helicopter pilots and Green\nBerets.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The MPRI has been in\nthe Balkans for years. MPRI military advisers helped plan Storm and Strike, the\nCroatian offensive that was responsible for driving out 350,000 Croatian Serbs\nfrom the Krajina province. In 1996, just one year later, the MPRI received a\n$400 million State Department contract to train and equip the Bosnian\nCroat-Muslim Federation Army.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Assistant Secretary of\nState for European and Canadian Affairs Richard Holbrooke persuaded the State\nDepartment to license Military Professional Resources Inc. (MPRI), a private\nmilitary contractor, to provide training to the Croatian army..&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">According to\nMPRI information officer Joseph Allred, the firm exists so that \u201cthe US can\nhave influence as part of its national strategy on other nations without\nemploying its own army British SAS teams, US Special Forces, and\nrepresentatives from Military Professional Resources Inc. (MPRI) are actively\ntraining KLA fighters at bases in Northern Albania<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">MPRI was contracted by\nthe Pentagon to organize and train the Croatian Army, which is acknowledged to\nhave carried out the most vicious campaign in the Balkans since the Nazi\ninvasion in the 1940s--the August 1995 offensive against Serbian farmers in the\nKrajina region.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A report in the July\n28,1997, Nation magazine detailed the role played by MPRI and the Pentagon in\nthis criminal campaign, which left hundreds of thousands of Serbs homeless.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Finally, this March 21, the New York Times carried a front-page story about a\nreport by the International War Crimes Tribunal in The Hague that characterized\nthis attack as probably the most brutal event in the Balkans in the last\ndecade. The report was then quickly buried.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Croatian government\nrecently confirmed that several of its generals have \"taken leave\" to\ngo work with the KLA. KLA was founded by the CIA. And the funding was funneled\nthrough drug-smuggling operations in Europe.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When it appeared that\nan agreement for Kosovo autonomy was about to be reached between Slobodan\nMilosevic and Ibrahim Rugova in 1998, the CIA stepped up KLA attacks on\nYugoslav police units. The Yugoslav police attempts to curtail the vicious crimes\nof KLA were used as the pretext for NATO's attacks.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The peace negotiations\nwere stage-managed and the Serbs were told: Surrender and be occupied, or don't\nsurrender and be destroyed. The impossible terms--- <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">NATO general commanding\nthe occupation \"shall have the sole authority\" to take virtually any\naction he liked, such as shooting down aircraft inside Serbia.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">NATO would have\ncomplete and unaccountable political power, with its occupying force\n\"immune from all legal process, whether civil, administrative or criminal\n[and], under all circumstances and at all times, immune from [all laws]\ngoverning any criminal or disciplinary offences which may be committed by NATO\npersonnel in the Federal Republic of Yugoslavia ...&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">NATO personnel shall enjoy,\ntogether with their vehicles, vessels, aircraft and equipment, free and\nunrestricted passage and unimpeded access throughout the Federal Republic of\nYugoslavia, including associated airspace and territorial waters\".<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Propaganda is not\noverlooked. The Government of Yugoslavia \"shall, upon simple request,\ngrant all telecommunications services, including broadcast services, needed for\n[the occupation], as determined by NATO. This shall be free of cost.\"&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">And\nthe ideological basis for the occupation is left in no doubt. \"NATO is\ngranted the use of airports, roads, rail and ports without payment of fees,\nduties, dues, tolls or charge. The economy shall function in accordance with\nfree market principles.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">No government anywhere\ncould accept this. It was an outrageous provocation. On March 19, the Kosovo\nLiberation Army, which Madeleine Albright and Robin Cook had earlier dismissed\nas terrorists, signed the \"accords\".&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Serbs, of course, refused.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">And it was not just Milosevic. The elected Yugoslav Parliament, reported The\nNew York Times correspondent in Belgrade, \"rejected NATO troops in Kosovo\n[but] supported the idea of a United Nations force to monitor a political\nsettlement there\". Five days later, NATO attacked. The Serbs had been\nnicely stitched up.</span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: red;\"><b>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">On March 19, 1999, &nbsp;War Criminal US President Bill Clinton told\nthe world\u2019s press, \u201cWe should remember what happened in the village of Racak\nback in January, innocent men, women and children were taken from their homes\nto a gully, forced to kneel in the dirt, sprayed with gunfire\u2014not because of\nanything they had done, but because of who they were.\u201d <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Five days later NATO\nplanes, headed by the US, began bombing Belgrade\u2014without UN sanction\u2014American exceptionalism\nat its best .</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-fjBl0XlIibw/WSSHH0YA7sI/AAAAAAABTgs/9dppThjKaj4EFXcxB1lwmTQ3qpLXmUa0gCLcB/s1600/nw799bDfL0By8.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">TRUTH :&nbsp; This incident was a false flag attack and a Hegelian\ndialectic . The pathologists\u2019 report shows only one of the dead was aged under\n15, and only one was a woman.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">USA proclaimed the\ndiscovery of some 40 bodies in Racak as proof positive of a \u201ccrime against\nhumanity\u201d committed on the orders of Serbian leader Slobodan Milosevic.&nbsp; &nbsp;The FAKE\nRacak \u201cmassacre\u201d played a central part in justifying NATO\u2019s war against Serbia.\n&nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">LIAR American William\nWalker, who was OSCE (Organisation for Security and Co-operation in Europe)\nchief in Kosovo in 1999, played a central role in Washington\u2019s propaganda\noffensive to gain support for Western military intervention. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Walker falsely claimed those killed in Racak were\nunarmed villagers who had been shot at close range. &nbsp;&nbsp;He said many of the bodies showed signs of\nbeing deliberately disfigured. &nbsp;Rothschild\u2019s\nmedia &nbsp;broadcasts around the world\ncarried pictures of the dead lying in a shallow gully.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The pathologists found\nonly six bodies had suffered a single gunshot wound, with most being covered in\nmultiple wounds. The trajectories showed the bullets coming from many different\nangles and elevations.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Very few of the dead appeared to have been shot at close\nrange. And in contrast to the claims by Walker, no evidence of deliberate\ndisfigurement of the bodies was found.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These findings\nsupported those eyewitnesses who reported that there had been violent clashes\nbetween Kosovo Liberation Army (KLA) forces and Serbian units near Racak the\nday before the bodies were found, and that the dead may have been killed in\nthis firefight. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\">Below: A Serb tortured and killed by Islamic KLA merceneries&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-zlR_0Y3iU6M/WSSLLr9ahUI/AAAAAAABThQ/xrdunGJ9FEEKnwn2OUWYwKhH2uKLkDrLQCLcB/s1600/0ftt22.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"374\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-zlR_0Y3iU6M/WSSLLr9ahUI/AAAAAAABThQ/xrdunGJ9FEEKnwn2OUWYwKhH2uKLkDrLQCLcB/s640/0ftt22.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt;\">Racak was at that time\na stronghold of the KLA. </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There was NO massacre. 40 bodies were only\ndiscovered some 12 hours later.</span>&nbsp; &nbsp;<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The full report by the Finnish pathologists\nremains under lock and key to this day.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Organization for Security and\nCo-operation in Europe (OSCE) is a Bilderberg Club controlled , world's largest\nsecurity-oriented intergovernmental organization. Its mandate includes issues\nsuch as arms control and the promotion of human rights, freedom of the press\nand fair elections.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Serbian authorities\ndenied their forces had carried out any executions in Racak, and said the\nbodies could well be those of dead KLA fighters. &nbsp;&nbsp;Pathologists declared &nbsp;\u201cNot a single body bears any sign of\nexecution.\u201d This was suppressed by Jew Rothschild\u2019s media.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Kosovo Liberation\nArmy ( KLA) was an ethnic-Albanian paramilitary organisation that sought the\nseparation of Kosovo from the Federal Republic of Yugoslavia (FRY) and Serbia\nduring the 1990s and the eventual creation of a Greater Albania. &nbsp;This Islamic organization ( like ISIS ) was\ncreated , armed and funded by Bilderberg club<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Its campaign against\nYugoslav security forces, police, government officers and ethnic Serb villages\nprecipitated a major crackdown by the Yugoslav military and Serb paramilitaries\nwithin Kosovo known as the Kosovo War of 1998\u201399. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The KLA was supported\nby foreign merceneries funded by Zionist Jews volunteers, including Islamist\nJihadists &nbsp;from Western Europe of ethnic\nAlbanian, Turkish, and North African origin &nbsp;. They were supported by Yemeni fighters with\nSaudis and Egyptians, funded by &nbsp;Zionist\nJews.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Kosovo war ultimately featured a military campaign by NATO against\nFRY armed forces during March\u2013June 1999.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Everybody knew that USA\nsupported the vicious KLA and Albanian separatists, who were engaged in violent\nguerrilla actions against Serbian police and army posts in Kosovo.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">To bring NATO directly\ninto the conflict it was necessary to scuttle the Rambouillet peace talks and\novercome scepticism in the KLA, particularly among America\u2019s European allies.\nPresenting the Racak killings as a deliberate Serbian atrocity would have precisely\nthis aim.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When a KVM team arrived\nat the scene of the Ra\u010dak massacre, they found \" 40 bodies 23 of which\nwere lying in a ditch\".&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Kosovo Verification Mission (KVM) controlled\nby Bilderberg Club, was an OSCE mission to verify that the Serbian, and\nYugoslav forces were complying with the UN October Agreement to end atrocities\nin Kosovo, withdraw armed forces from Kosovo, and abide by a ceasefire.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Despite\nbeing much larger and more complex than any previous OSCE mission, the KVM was\nput together in undue haste; parts of the team arrived in Kosovo a month after\nthe 16 October agreement.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">William Walker declared\n(in his capacity as head of KVM) that the Yugoslav police had carried out a\nmassacre of civilians at Racak on January 15th.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Yugoslav authorities\nretorted that local police had in fact conducted an operation in this village\nagainst the Kosovo Libration Army and that several KLA soliders had died in\ncross-fire.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As later reported by several French newspapers (Le Monde, Le Figaro\nand Liberation), it was confirmed that the \u201cRacak massacre\u201d was indeed a fake\nput together with a view to discrediting Belgrade:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cEventually, even the\nLos Angeles Times joined in, running a story entitled \u201cRacak Massacre\nQuestions: Were Atrocities Faked?\u201d The theory behind all these expose was that\nthe KLA had gathered their own dead after the battle, removed their uniforms,\nput them in civilian clothes, and then called in the observers.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">American William\nWalker, who was OSCE (Organisation for Security and Co-operation in Europe)\nchief in Kosovo in 1999, played a central role in Washington\u2019s propaganda\noffensive to gain support for Western military intervention.&nbsp; &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; Because this is actually a possibility. This\nconclusion was included in our first investigation report, and also in our\nlater forensic investigations, which we made in November 1999 directly in\nRacak. &nbsp;&nbsp;And we passed on this conclusion\ndirectly to the Court of Justice in The Hague.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">NATO did not allow forensic\nexperts from Yugoslav and Byelorussian experts , claiming that they were tools\nof Serbian president Slobodan Milosevic, so NATO asked the OSCE (Organization\nfor Security and Cooperation in Europe), to pick a third team. The Kosovo Liberation Army\nwas fostered and supported in its actions by the American Government.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Ra\u010dak\nincident was presented as a Serbian Massacre of a Albanian village. There\nsome 23 bodies were found in a shallow trench, and 17 more were found scattered\nthroughout the village.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It reported on Jan. 21,\n1999, a few days after the incident, that an Associated Press TV crew had\nfilmed a gun battle at Racak between Serb police and KLA guerillas.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Indeed, the\ncrew was present because the Serbs had tipped them off that they were going to\nenter the village to arrest a man accused of shooting a police officer. font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Within\nweeks, a multilateral international conference was convened and by March had\nprepared a draft agreement known as the Rambouillet Accords, calling for the\nrestoration of Kosovo's autonomy and the deployment of Rothschild\u2019s private\narmy , NATO peacekeeping forces.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Yugoslav delegation found the terms\nunacceptable and refused to sign the draft. Between 24 March and 10 June 1999,\nRothschild\u2019s private army NATO intervened by bombing Yugoslavia aimed to force\nMilo\u0161evi\u0107 to withdraw his forces from Kosovo</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">NATO was threatening\nMilosevic to either sign the Rambouillet \u201cpeace\u201d agreement or be bombed.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Rambouillet\nAgreement was a proposed peace agreement between the Federal Republic of\nYugoslavia and a delegation representing the Albanian majority population of\nKosovo. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It was drafted by the North\nAtlantic Treaty Organisation (NATO) and named for the Ch\u00e2teau de Rambouillet,\nwhere it was initially proposed. &nbsp;The\nsignificance of the agreement lies in the fact that Yugoslavia refused to\naccept it, which NATO used as justification to start the Kosovo War.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Belgrade's\nrejection was based on the argument that the agreement contained provisions for\nKosovo's autonomy that went further than the Serbian/Yugoslav government saw as\nreasonable.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Yugoslav delegation did\naccept the political portions of the Rambouillet draft agreement, but not its\n\u201cAnnex B\u201d with the Points 2, 5 and 7 that proposed and required a military\noccupation of the entire territory of FR Yugoslavia (i.e. Serbia with 2\nautonomous provinces, and Montenegro).&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Therefore, the global public opinion was\nan object of manipulated information which told that Serbs were \u201crejecting\narrival of peace-keeping forces in Kosovo (and Metohija)\u201d.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">To understand what\nexactly caused FR Yugoslavia to reject the military portion of the document\noffered in Rambouillet, one has to read its provisions:--<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(I) The NATO troops are\nallowed to freely and without charges to use any and all land, water and air\nspaces and equipments;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(II) Their soldiers\nwill enjoy diplomatic immunity and will not be held responsible for any damage\nmade on the territory of FR Yugoslavia under civil and/or criminal laws;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(III) their soldiers\nmay carry weapons on them even when wearing civil attire;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(IV) Their soldiers may\nat any time take for use the entire electro-magnetic space of FRY, that is, the\nTV and radio frequencies, police and ambulance frequencies, civil protection\nand other frequencies, without announcement or any fee or charges whatsoever;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(V) Their soldiers may\nat any time arrest any citizen on the FRY territory, without any warrant or\ndecision of a court or any FRY authority.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://www.serendipity.li/nato/app_b.htm\"><span style=\"background-color: lime; font-size: large;\">http://www.serendipity.li/nato/app_b.htm</span></a><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Rothschild\u2019s media ,\nAmerican and European officials, have withheld the truth about the content of\nthe military document by charging the leaders of Serbia and Yugoslav President\nfor \u201cthe lack of cooperation in the efforts to find a peaceful solution\u201d.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Igor Ivanov [the\nForeign Minister of Russia] claimed the Russian side didn't know about the\nannexe at all. The surprise is that besides the Americans, no one knew about\nthe annexe. We were given it one day before the end of the Paris talks - at `a\nminute before midnight'. Before that, we heard only rumours about the\nimplementation of the political agreement.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The full annexes\ndemanded Nato rights of road, rail and air passage across all of Yugoslavia,\nthe use of radio stations, even the waiving of any claims of damages against\nNato. For any state - even one as grotesque as Serbia - this would have\namounted to occupation<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In commentary released\nto the press, former United States Secretary of State Henry Kissinger declared\nthat:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Rambouillet text,\nwhich called on Serbia to admit NATO troops throughout Yugoslavia, was a\nprovocation, an excuse to start bombing. Rambouillet is not a document that an\nangelic Serb could have accepted. It was a terrible diplomatic document that\nshould never have been presented in that form.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2014\u2009Henry Kissinger,\nDaily Telegraph, 28 June 1999<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">NATO'S LAST-MINUTE\nDEMAND<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"Nato personnel\nshall enjoy, together with their vehicles, vessels, aircraft and equipment,\nfree and unrestricted passage and unimpeded access throughout the FRY (Federal\nRepublic of Yugolsavia) including associated air space and territorial waters.\nThis shall include but not be limited to, the right of bivouac, manoeuvre,\nbillet and utilisation of any areas or facilities as required for support,\ntraining and operations.\"---&nbsp; <i>Interim\nAgreement for Peace and Self-Government - Kosovo, Appendix to page 8, March\n1999<o:p></o:p></i></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Belgrade's rejection of\nthe Rambouillet Agreement&nbsp; was based on\nthe argument that the agreement contained provisions for Kosovo's autonomy that\nwent further than the Serbian/Yugoslav government saw as reasonable.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the end, on 18 March\n1999, the Albanian, American and British delegation signed what became known as\nthe 'Rambouillet Accords' &nbsp;while the\nSerbian and Russian delegations refused.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The accords called for NATO\nadministration of Kosovo as an autonomous province within Yugoslavia; a force\nof 30,000 NATO troops to maintain order in Kosovo; an unhindered right of\npassage for NATO troops on Yugoslav territory, including Kosovo; and immunity\nfor NATO and its agents to Yugoslav law.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Clinton's Secretary of\nState war criminal JEWESS Madeleine Albright, &nbsp;kept demanding that Yugoslavia be bombed\nimmediately. &nbsp;&nbsp;Albright, like a kid\nagonizingly counting down the hours to Christmas, would have to wait until\nafter Milosevic's rejection of NATO's ultimata at Rambouillet to get her wish.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Albright delivered an\n\"offer\" to Milosevic that no national leader could accept. Unless he\nagreed to the foreign military occupation of his country, with the occupying\nforces \"outside the legal process\", and to the imposition of a\nneo-liberal \"free market\", Serbia would be bombed..&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: white; font-size: large;\">The aim was to\ncrush Europe's last independent \"socialist\" state and a method for\nthe Zionist Jews to grab the RARE EARTHS of Kosovo.</span></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">NATO required that\nYugoslavia revamp its economy along free market lines. NATO also demanded the\nright to move NATO troops in and around all of Yugoslavia, such troops not to\nbe subject to Yugoslavian law and jurisdiction.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Madeleine knew that the\nSerbs would never agree to the terms of Appendix B (if they did then Kosovo\nwould become a U.S.-controlled territory), and they did not. JEWESS Madeleine\nwas about to get her kosher war.</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Yugoslav Government\nrejected the NATO proposal, with the result that NATO was allegedly forced, for\nhumanitarian reasons, to carry out its bombing threat. This resulted in\nceaseless day and night bombing with an estimated 14,800 sorties over almost\nthree months.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-2DGf3SNILM8/WSSGhdxn58I/AAAAAAABTgk/6Wk5afkRas4A77LIadmv2vyPXiWdP6zMgCLcB/s1600/d12d133e18428ggcb09c4050af79d0a25f.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"454\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-2DGf3SNILM8/WSSGhdxn58I/AAAAAAABTgk/6Wk5afkRas4A77LIadmv2vyPXiWdP6zMgCLcB/s640/d12d133e18428ggcb09c4050af79d0a25f.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Albright baby apparently\nbelieved that a few days of bombing would be all that was necessary to cause\nMilosevic to surrender. If so she miscalculated badly. Not only did Milosevic\nnot surrender but he counter-attacked, in the form of &nbsp;forced expulsion of the Albanian population.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hundreds of thousands became refugees, on trucks, tractors and trains headed\nfor the borders with Albania and Macedonia. And there was nothing that the NATO\ngenerals could do to stop this.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pretending that an\neffect of the bombing was its cause, NATO apologists have pointed to the mass\nexodus of Albanians from Kosovo as an international crime</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When the Croats, supported\nby NATO backing and encouragement, drove the Serbs from the Krajina area a few\nyears ago, with 300,000 Serbs forcibly expelled from their homes,\nthis conduct evoked no criticism from NATO humanitarians. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Currently with Kosovo under benevolent NATO\noccupation, some 110,000 or more Kosovo Serbs have been forced into other parts\nof Yugoslavia under threat of murder by the KLA. Who condemns or prevents this\nexodus?&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It has been estimated that during the whole period of NATO\nmachinations, 720,000 Serbian refugees have been driven into Yugoslavia. This\nhas produced a deafening silence in UN, Rothschild\u2019s media and USA and Europe.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Roma gypsies have\nIndian DNA</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; color: purple; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cFree market reforms\u201d\nare envisaged for Kosovo under the supervision of the Bretton Woods\ninstitutions. Article I (Chapter 4a) of the Rambouillet Agreement stipulates\nthat: \u201cThe economy of Kosovo shall function in accordance with free market\nprinciples\u201d.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As the\nfirst bombs fell, the elected parliament in Belgrade, which included some of\nMilosevic's fiercest opponents, voted overwhelmingly to reject it.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-6OPSXFujFp8/WSSFx_44-UI/AAAAAAABTgc/QcHBiM7i46MZRjyafQrVoO44CblheX3_wCLcB/s1600/Civilian_refugehes_killed_by_U_.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">While negotiations were\nongoing in Rambouillet, NATO decided to increase the readiness of its assigned\nforces \u201cso as to make them able to execute the operation within 48 hours\u201d.&nbsp; &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In\nother words, \u201cpeace negotiations\u201d had been initiated in Rambouillet (contrary\nto the Vienna Convention) under the threat of impending air strikes. NATO had\ngranted a three weeks period to the parties meeting in Rambouillet to conclude\nnegotiations.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/KOY6_ytgTlg/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/KOY6_ytgTlg?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; color: red; font-size: large;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; color: red; font-size: large;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; color: red; font-size: large;\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Camp Bondsteel is the\nmain base of the United States Army under KFOR command in Kosovo. Located near\nFerizaj in the eastern part of Kosovo, the base serves as the NATO headquarters\nfor KFOR's Multinational Battle Group East (MNBG-E). The camp occupies 955\nacres &nbsp;of land.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; color: red; font-size: large;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-NGuMjfjtIIk/WSScDwxX_PI/AAAAAAABTho/IadKgVbzsLoeE0olrc6BkrGlynH8w-RPgCLcB/s1600/cttttamp-bondsteel_2000.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"360\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-NGuMjfjtIIk/WSScDwxX_PI/AAAAAAABTho/IadKgVbzsLoeE0olrc6BkrGlynH8w-RPgCLcB/s640/cttttamp-bondsteel_2000.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; color: red; font-size: large;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The United States Army\nhas been criticised for using the base as a detention facility, and for the\nconditions faced by the detainees there.. In November 2005, Alvaro Gil-Robles,\nthe human rights envoy of the Council of Europe, described the camp as a\n\"smaller version of Guantanamo\" following a visit.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Established in June\n1999, it is the main base for the US army in Kosovo. &nbsp;Camp Bondsteel serves the NATO mission in\nKosovo. &nbsp;Camp Bondsteel is the largest\nand the most expensive foreign military base built by the US in Europe, since\nthe Vietnam War.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Camp Bondsteel strategically lies close to the planned\nAlbanian-Macedonian-Bulgarian Oil (AMBO) pipeline. Also known as the\nTrans-Balkan, the pipeline project will transport the Caspian oil from Bulgaria\nto Albania via Macedonia. The $1.5bn AMBO pipeline is sponsored by the US-based\nconsortium Albanian Macedonian Bulgarian Oil Corporation.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The south perimeter\nof the Kosovo base has a 52 helipad airfield for helicopter aviation. It was\nconstructed in August 1999. The outer perimeter of the base is about 14km and\nis surrounded by a 2.5m high earthen and concrete barrier wall.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The base is protected by 84km of concertina\nwire and 11 guard towers, built with concrete pad and accessible entrance\nladders, around the perimeter of the camp. They allow the soldiers to view the\narea from 18ft above the ground.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; color: red; font-size: large;\"></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; color: red; font-size: large;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/MNqoSKf9HxI/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/MNqoSKf9HxI?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\">NATO\u2019s ultimatum over\nthe Rambouillet \u2018agreement\u2019 was \u2018an infringement of the Vienna Convention (Art\n52) which states \"A treaty, the signature to which has been obtained\nthrough the threat of force...is illegal and void\"\u2018:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; The sodality was organized to increase the personal\nholiness of its members and to train them in charitable work for others\u2014a way\nto grab power<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A goal of Sodality has\nalways been to further personal piety among its members by urging devotion to\nChrist in the Blessed Sacrament, devoted imitation of Mary, use of prayer, etc.\nengaged in the lay apostolate. In the parish, lay apostolate is the organized\nhelp given by parishioners to their parish priest in his apostolic work by\nparticipating in charitable and apostolic work. Sodality is a spiritual\norganization where Catholics act together for the Savior, the Blessed Mother,\nand the Church.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sodality house is Seva\nNiketan, a Christian Life Community (CLC) centre in Mumbai.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The CLC is what is\ncalled a Sodality; a group of lay Christian people who get together for their\nown spiritual upliftment and to do pious acts and charity.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The CLC\ncongregations have traditionally been led by Jesuit crypto JEW &nbsp;priests. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">JEW Ignatius of Loyola was the founder of the\nJesuit order (the correct name is the Society of Jesus).
